I am too busy these days to train anyone.

You've taken a weight off my shoulders, {playername}. I shall tell my sergeants to send you the recruits and attach them to your command. Also, I'll advance you some money to help with expenses. Here, this purse should do it. Thank you for your help.
Oh, of course. I had expected as much. Well, good luck to you then.

You probably know that I am the lord of the {reg9?town:village} of {s3}. However, it has been months since {s3} has delivered the taxes and rents due me as its rightful lord. Apparently the populace there has grown unruly lately and I need someone to go there and remind them of their obligations. And to . . . persuade them if they won't listen. If you go there and raise the taxes they owe me, I will grant you one-fifth of everything you collect.
A fair offer, {s65}. We have an agreement.
Forgive me, I don't have the time.

Welcome news, {playername}. I will entrust this matter to you. Remember, those {reg9?townsmen:peasants} are foxy beasts, they will make every excuse not to pay me my rightful incomes. Do not let them fool you.
Oh, yes. Well, good luck to you then.

I have something you could help with, an issue with the lawless villain known as {s4}.  He murdered one of my men and has been on the run from his judgment ever since. I can't let him get away with avoiding justice, so I've put a bounty of 300 coins on his head. Friends of the murdered man reckon that this assassin may have taken refuge with his kinsmen at {s3}. You might be able to hunt him down and give him what he deserves, and claim the bounty for yourself.
Then I will hunt him down and execute the law.
I am too busy to go after him at the moment.

That's excellent, {playername}. I will be grateful to you and so will the family of the man he murdered. And of course the bounty on his head will be yours if you can get him. Well, good hunting to you.
As you wish, {playername}.I suppose there are plenty of bounty hunters around to get the job done . . .

The wretched truth is that I owe a considerable sum of money to one of the merchants here in {s3}. I've no intention of paying it back, of course, but that loud-mouthed fool is making a terrible fuss about it. He even had the audacity to come and threaten me -- me! -- with a letter of complaint to the trade guilds and bankers. Why, he'd ruin my good reputation! So I need a {man/woman} I can trust, someone who will guarantee the man's silence. For good.
Worry not, he shan't breathe a word.
I'm no common murderer, my lord. Find someone else for your dirty job.

Very good. I trust in your skill and discretion, {playername}. Do not disappoint me. Go now and wait for my word, I'll send you a message telling when and where you can catch the merchant. Dispose of him for me and I shall reward you generously.

I have a sensitive matter which needs tending to, {playername}, and no trustworthy retainers to take care of it. The fact is that I have a spy in {s13} to keep an eye on things for me, and report anything that might warrant my attention. Every week I send someone to collect the spy's reports and bring them back to me. The job's yours if you wish it.
I don't mind a bit of skullduggery. Count me in.
I must decline. This cloak-and-dagger work isn't fit for me.
Excellent! Make your way to {s13} as soon as you can, the spy will be waiting.
{s13} is heavily defended. How can I get close without being noticed?

You shall have to use stealth. Take care to avoid enemy strongholds, villages and patrols, and don't bring too many men with you. If you fail to sneak in the first time, give it a while for the garrison to lower its guard again, or you may have a difficult time infiltrating the town.
How will I recognise the spy?

Once you get to {s13} you must talk to the locals, the spy will be one of them. If you think you've found the spy, say the phrase '{s11}' The spy will respond with the phrase '{s12}' Thus you will know the other, and {reg7?she:he} will give you any information {reg7?she:he}'s gathered in my service.
Will I be paid?
Of course, I have plenty of silver in my coffers for loyal {men/women} like you. Do well by me, {playername}, and you'll rise high.
I know what to do. Farewell, my lord.
Good luck, {playername}. Remember, the secret phrase is '{s11}' The counterphrase is '{s12}' Bring any reports back to me, and I'll compensate you for your trouble.
As you wish, {playername}, but I strongly advise you to forget anything I told you about any spies. They do not exist, have never existed, and no one will ever find them. Remember that.

This peace with {s13} ill suits me, {playername}. We've let those swine have their way for far too long. Now they get stronger with each passing and their arrogance knows no bounds. I say, we must wage war on them before it's too late! Unfortunately, some of the bleeding hearts among our realm's lords are blocking a possible declaration of war. Witless cowards with no stomach for blood.
You are right, {s65}, but what can we do?
I disagree, my lord. It is better that there be peace.

Ah, 'tis good to hear someone who understands! As a matter of fact, there is something we can do, {playername}. A little bit of provocation... If one of our war parties managed to enter their territory and pillage one of their caravans, or raided one of their villages, and perhaps left behind a little token or two of the {s14}, they would have ample cause to declare war on us. And then, well, even the cowards among us must rise to defend themselves. So what do you say? Are you interested?
An excellent plan. Count me in.
Why don't you do that yourself?

Well, {playername}, some of the lords in our sovereignty won't like the idea of someone inciting a war without their consent. They are already looking for an excuse to get at me, and if I did this they could make me pay for it dearly. You, on the other hand, are young and well-liked and daring, so you might just get away with it. And of course I will back you up and defend your actions against your opponents. All in all, a few lords might be upset at your endeavour, but I am sure you won't be bothered with that.
That seems reasonable. I am willing to do this.
I don't like this. Find yourself someone else to take the blame for your schemes.
Very good! A raid on a caravan, or, if you can't manage that, an attack on one of their villages, should do the trick. Now, good luck and good hunting. Go set the borders aflame!
Ah, you think so? But how long will your precious peace last? Not long, believe me.
Hm. As you wish, {playername}. I thought you had some fire in you, but it seems I was wrong.

Well, some of the serfs working my fields in {s4} have run away. The ungrateful swine, I let them plough my fields and rent my cottages, and this is how they repay me! From what I've been hearing, they're running to {s3} as fast as they can, and have split up into three groups to try and avoid capture. I want you to capture all three groups and fetch them back to {s4} by whatever means necessary. I should really have them hanged for attempting to escape, but we need hands for the upcoming harvest, so I'll let them go off this time with a good beating.

I have good information that a man in this very town is actually an enemy spy. He should be seized and hanged for his impudence, but we also believe that very soon he will leave town to meet with his master, the man to whom the spy feeds all his little whispers. The spy himself is of little import, but the master is a dangerous man, and could tell us a great deal if we could only get our hands on him...

I want you to wait here until the spy leaves town. Then you must follow him, stealthily, to the meeting place. You must take absolute care not to be seen by the spy on your way, else he may suspect foul play and turn back. When the master appears, you must ambush and arrest them and bring the pair back to me. Alive, if you please.
I'll do it, {s65}.
No, this skulking is not for me.
Good, I'm sure you'll do a fine job of it. One of my men will point the spy out to you when he leaves, so you will know the man to follow. Remember, I want them both, and I want them alive.
A shame. Well, carry on as you were, {playername}...

There is a difficult job I need done, {playername}, and you may be the {man/one} who can carry it off. I need someone to capture one of the noble lords of {s13} and bring him to me. Afterwards, I'll be able to exchange him in return for a relative of mine held by {s13}. It is a simple enough job, but whomever you choose will be guarded by an elite band of personal retainers. Are you up for a fight?
Consider it done, {s65}.
I must refuse, {s65}. I am not a kidnapper.
I like your spirit! Go and bring me one of our enemies, and I'll toast your name in my hall when you return! And reward you for your efforts, of course...
Clearly you lack the mettle I had thought you possessed. Very well, {playername}, I will find someone else.
I don't have a job for you right now, but your companion {s3} is a skilled {reg3?lass:fellow} and I need someone with {reg3?her:his} talents. Will you lend {reg3?her:him} to me for a while?
How long will you be needing {reg3?her:him}?
Just a few days, a week at most.
Then I will leave {s3} with you for one week.
I am sorry, but I cannot do without {s3} for a whole week.
I cannot thank you enough, {playername}. Worry not, your companion shall be returned to you with due haste.
Well, that's damned unfortunate, but I suppose I cannot force you or {s3} to agree. I shall have to make do without.

Some time ago, I loaned out a considerable sum of money to {s3}. {reg4} coins, to be precise. {reg0?She:He} was supposed to pay it back within a month but I haven't received a copper from {reg0?her:him} since. That was months ago. If you could collect the debt from {reg0?her:him} on my behalf, I would be grateful indeed. I would even let you keep one fifth of the money for your trouble. What do you say?
Do you know where I can find {s3}, {s65}?

If you leave now, you should be able to find {reg0?her:him} at {s4}. I've no doubt that {reg0?she:he} will be suitably embarassed by {reg0?her:his} conduct and give you all the money {reg0?she:he} owes me.
Then I will talk to {s3} on your behalf.
Forgive me, {s65}, but I doubt I would be more successful than yourself.
You made me very happy by accepting this {playername}. Please, talk to {s3} and don't leave {reg0?her:him} without my money.
Perhaps not, {playername}. I suppose I'm never getting that money back...

I tell you, that blubbering fool {s13} is not fit to rule {s14}. God knows {reg3?she:he} would be divested of {reg3?her:his} lands in an instant were it not for one of {reg3?her:his} loyal vassals, {s15}. As long as {reg3?she:he} has {reg3?her:his} vassal aiding {reg3?her:him}, it will be a difficult job beating {reg3?her:him}. So I need to get {s15} out of the picture, and I have a plan just to do that... With your help, naturally.
{s66}, I am all ears.
I don't wish to involve myself in anything dishonourable against {s15}.
Dishonourable? Bah! I was hoping I could count on you, {playername}, but you've shown me what a fool I was. I shall have to find someone whose loyalty I can trust.

I have written a fake letter to {s15}, bearing my own seal, which implicates {reg4?her:him} in a conspiracy with us to stage a coup in {s14}, in my favour. If we can make {s13} believe the letter is genuine, {reg3?she:he} will deal with {s15} very swiftly. Of course, the challenge there is to convince {s13} that the letter is indeed real...
Prosím pokračuj, {s65}...
Ne, nehodlám si špinit s tímto.

A to tady přijdeš na řadu ty. Vezmeš dopis pro {s14} a dáš ho jednomu ze svých vojáků, který ho pak vezme do {s15}. Jeden z mých špehů pak informuje stráže, aby ho zatkli. Až najdou dopis, vezmou ho do {s15}. Tvého muže budou samozřejmě mučit, aby z něho dostali pravdu, ale vše co bude vědět je, že od tebe dostal dopis, který měl doručit {s15} co nejdiskrétněji. {s13} ví, že mi sloužíš a ten hlupák pak celé té šarádě jistě uvěří.
To je vše?

je tu ještě jedna věc... Tvůj poslíček musí být někdo důvěryhodný. Kdyby to byl pouhý rolník, někdo postradatelný, {s13} by {reg3?Mohla:Mohl} pojmout podezření, že tu něco nehraje. {reg3?Ona:On} může mít rozum šneka, ale i šnek vidí očividné. Dej ten dopis jednomu z tvých vysoce postavených mužů. {s9}, například.
Cože? nemůžu poslat jednoho ze svých {s9} na jistou smrt!
Pak tedy {s8}.
Ale no ták, {playername}. Jsou místa pro sentiment, ale ne teď a tady. Věř mi, budeš štědře {odměněn/odměněna}, a jaký jiný smysl mají vojáci, než zemřít na tvůj příkaz?
Takže {s8} tedy.
Ne, neobětuji žádného ze svých mužů.

Nemůžu ti říct jak jsem rád, že to slyším, {playername}. Zbavíš mě jednoho z mých největších břemen. Tady je ten dopis a 300 zlatých k tomu na výdaje. Pamatuj, že toho bude mnohem víc, pokud uspěješ. Mnohem, mnohem víc...

Skupina mých vojáků byla zajata během nedávné bitvy. Naštěstí máme dohodu o vzájemné výměně zajatců. Propustí mé muže, ale chtějí za to stejný počet mužů odpovídající hodnosti. Mužů, které nemám, proto potřebuji {dobrého válačníka/dobrou válečnici}, aby mi sehnala {reg1} {s3}, jako zajatce, které bych mohl vyměnit.
Ne, {playername}. Teď od tebe nic nepotřebuji.
Můžeš se na mě spolehnout, {s65}.
Obávám se, že takovou misi teď nemohu přijmout.
Výborně, {playername}, výborně. Mám v tebe velkou důvěru.
Takže takhle? No, předpokládám, že to není úkol pro tebe. Podívám se po někom s trochou více odvahy.
Rád bych se přidal ke tvé družině.
Můj pane, rád bych byl přeřazen k jiné jednotce.
Můj pane, rád bych odešel z tvých služeb.
Můj pane, rád bych se na chvíli odpojil od tvé družiny.
Můj pane, jsem připraven vrátit se do služby.
Musím už jít.
Tenhle rozhovor je u konce. Odcházím.
Dovolte mi odejít.

Než odejdeš {playername}, mám pro tebe jeden úkol... Možná jsme nepřátele v téhle válce, ale věřím, že si myslíš stejně jako já, že se k sobě můžeme stále chovat civilizovaně.Také doufám, že budeš natolik {laskavý/laskavá}, že mi pomůžeš, v něčem velmi důležitém.
Poslouchám.

Můj přítel, starý válečník, je velmi nemocný. Nakazil se jednou z ran utržených v bitvě, a pokud ho brzy neošetří nějaký chirurg, tak zemře. Ten muž je mi dobrým přítelem, {playername}, ale je také paličatý, jak starý mrzout a odmítá se nechat kýmkoliv vyšetřit, protože nevěří místním léčitelům. Slyšel jsem, že máš se sebou velmi dobrého chirurga. Pokud bys ho nechal podívat se na mého přítele, možná by ho přesvědčil, aby dal souhlas k operaci. Prosím, budu ti velmi zavázán, pokud mi vyjdeš vstříc.
Znovu se setkáme.
Brzy na shledanou, má paní. Vždy budu {vaším obdivovatelem/vaší obdivovatelkou}.
Ale jistě, {playername}. Brzy na shledanou.
Přeji vám šťastné cesty, {playername}.
Jistě, jistě, brzy na shledanou.
Znovu se setkáme.
Užíváš si cestu, {s65}?
Vcelku ano, {playername}. Děkuji, že se tak staráte.
Ano?
As you are my chief minister, I wish to speak to about affairs of state
Let's abandon our plan to {s10}.
Are you sure you want to drop that idea?
Yes, I am sure. Let's abandon that idea.
Vlastně, zapomeň na to.
Let us think of a way to improve our standing in this realm
My {reg65?wife:husband}, I would like to dedicate my successes in this recent tourney to you
I was thinking that perhaps we could host a feast
Let us take inventory of our household possessions
Anyway, that is the content of our larder.
We shall speak later, my {wife/husband}
My husband, I hearby pledge to be your wife, to stand with you in good times and bad. May the heavens smile upon us and bless us with children, livestock, and land.
I pledge the same. Let us be husband and wife.
Wait -- hold on... I'm not quite ready for this.

I now declare you and {s3} to be husband and wife. Go now to the chamber prepared for you, and we shall make arrangements for your bride to join {reg10?you in your hall in:your liege's court at} {s11}.
Ještě něco dalšího, {s0}?
A splendid idea, {s0}. However, let us wait for the current feast here to conclude, before organizing another.
A splendid idea, {s0}. However, we must establish a court before hosting a feast.
A splendid idea, {s0}. However, our realm has recently had a feast. Perhaps we should wait another {reg3} days before we organize another one.

A splendid idea, {s0}. However, to not insult our guests, we must make sure that we can provide a large and varied repast, for the lords, their families, and their retinues. All told, we should count on a couple of hundred mouths to feed, over several days. Let us take an inventory of our household possessions...
Let me add more items to our storehouses
All right -- let me reevalute what is there...
Let us dispatch the invitations
Let us wait, then

I shall send word, then, that we will host a feast as soon as conditions in the realm permit. You perhaps should continue to stock our larder, so that we may do justice to our reputation for hospitality.

Very well, then. Let the feast begin immediately at our court {reg4?here:} in {s9}. You perhaps should continue to stock our larder, so that we may do justice to our reputation for hospitality. You may declare the feast to be concluded at any time, either by beginning a campaign or by letting it be known that the vassals can return to their homes.
How wonderful it is... In a short while we shall be married! However, I should point out that, in the remaining few days, it is not customary for us to speak too much together.
Em, {playername}, you might not be used to our wedding customs, but I had hoped that someone would tell you... Speak first to my {s11}, {s4}.
I do not know where to find my {s11} {s10}, who by tradition should preside over our wedding. Perhaps we should wait until {reg4?she:he} can be found...
The honorable {s12} has agreed to allow us to return home to our families. We shall be departing shortly.
So great is my loneliness! How I miss my family!
You are a cad, to hold a {reg65?lady:free-spirited lad} like this...
It is strange. On occasion you have shown me such kindness, and yet you continue to hold me here against my will.
Why haven't my family paid my ransom? You may hold me as prisoner, but it seems that you care for me more than they do!
Greetings, {s0}. The tides of war have left me stranded here in this fortress, but I will shortly be departing.
{playername} -- I assume that you, as a {man/lady} of honor, will accord gentle-born {reg65?ladies:lads} such as ourselves the right to return to our families, and not demand a ransom.
We will shortly depart{s5}. It is good to know that some people in this world retain a sense of honor.
Of course, my lady
You assume wrong, {reg65?my lady:sirrah}!
What?! What infamy is this?
My apologies - you must have misunderstood me. Of course you may leave.
Contact your family to arrange for a ransom, my lady.
Then write to your family, and ask them to hurry up with the ransom!
{Změnil/Změnila} jsem názor, můžeš odejít.
Well, {playername} -- you fought a duel with {s10}, and lost. According to our custom and tradition, I should no longer receive you. Farewell, {playername}.

Oh {playername} -- I heard of your duel with {s10}. I wish now that you had never fought {reg3?her:him}, for our honor and tradition demand that, having lost to {reg3?her:him}, you now break off your suit with me. Farewell, {playername}.
Very well - we must do as tradition demands... Farewell, my lady
Let honor and tradition hang!
Oh, {playername}! Although people will talk, it would so break my heart to no longer be able to see you. We shall ignore this silly, cruel tradition.
No, {playername} -- I cannot afford to fritter away my good name, and neither can you.
Oh, {playername} -- I have heard that you won your duel with {s10}. I'm grateful that you have delivered me from that {reg3?woman:man}'s attentions!
Well, {playername} --  you won your duel with {s10}. Clearly, {reg3?she:he} was not worthy of my affections.
Well, {playername} --  you won your duel with {s10}. Oh, such foolishness, that {men/people} should fight over me! Sigh... But it is a bit romantic, I suppose.

Well, {playername} --  you won your duel with {s10}. Honor now demands that {reg0?she:he} and I no longer meet... I was fond of {reg0?her:him}, you know. You did me no service by fighting {reg0?her:him}.

My dear {playername}, how joyous to see you again! I heard you gave that vile {s13} a well-deserved lesson. I hope {reg3?she:he} never forgets {reg3?her:his} humiliation. I've a reward for you, but I fear it's little compared to what you've done for me.
Oh, it will just have to do.
{s66}, this is far too much!
Please, {s65}, no reward is necessary.
I was told that you sought satisfaction from {s13} to prove my innocence, {playername}. It was a fine gesture, and I thank you for your efforts.
I beg your forgiveness for my defeat, {s65}...

It matters not, dear {playername}. You tried. The truth cannot be proven at the point of a sword, but you willingly put your life at stake for my honour. That alone will convince many of my innocence.
Thank you for escorting me here, {playername}. Please accept this gift as a token of my gratitude. I hope we shall meet again sometime in the future.
It was an honor to serve you, {s65}.
Ah {playername} - you must have received my message. How happy I am that you could come!
{playername} - is there any word from my family?
I hear that my {s11} has refused your request to marry me. Does that mean that we must part?
Oh, {playername}, you brought {reg4?her:him} back to me! Thank you ever so much for rescuing my {s11}. Please, take this as some small repayment for your noble deed.
Oh, {playername}, you brought {reg4?her:him} back to me! Thank you ever so much for rescuing my {s11}. Please, take this as some small repayment for your noble deed.
Always an honour to serve, {s65}.
You must be {playername}. We have just had the honor of watching you distinguish yourself in the recent melee{s8}.
You must be {playername}. My {s15} {s16} has spoken most highly of you. I am delighted to make your acquaintance.
I say, you don't look familiar...
Ah, {playername}. How good it is to see you again. However, I believe that I am required elsewhere.
{playername} -- how good it is to see you. (Whispers:) I still remember your visits fondly.
Ah, {playername}. How spendid it was to see you distinguish yourself in the recent tourney.
I have sad news. I have become betrothed to {s5} -- against my will, I should say! Oh {playername} - I would so much rather be wed to you!
Good {playername} -- I have become betrothed to {s5}. It is now no longer seemly for us to see each other like this.

I must tell you -- there is another lord who has been paying me attentions, although I cannot abide {reg0?her:him}. I fear {reg0?she:he} has designs on me, and may try to force me to wed against my will.
{s11}It is probably not suitable for us to tarry too long here in conversation, but I would hope to see you again soon.
I was planning to retire for a little while, but perhaps we may have a chance to speak more later...
It is so delightful to have a chance to spend some time together.{s12}
What brings you here today?
No word so far...
On second thought, now is not the time for us to marry
Never! We must elope together at once!
Perhaps I may still be able to change your {s11}'s mind
So be it -- let us then part
Good {playername} -- you are a good and kind man, but a lady cannot defy her family. Such things are not done!
As you may know, I have been entertaining offers from a number of {gentlemen/suitors} such as yourself. I am not yet at a stage where I can commit to any of them.
Ah {playername}, you must realize. You are still finding your way in the world. I have great affection for you, {playername}, but I will not consign myself to obscurity.

Ah {playername}, although you are kind to me, I am not certain enough of your moral fiber to risk such a thing. Although I bear little affection for my betrothed, it would be a weighty thing to go against my family's wishes, and I am not certain enough of you to take that step.
Good {playername} -- to elope would be to throw away my ties with my family, which are everything to me! I have a considerable affection for you, but I am not sure that I am prepared to risk that.

Good {playername} -- I am not used to the hardships of campaigning as you are. I want a home to call my own. If you were lord of a castle or town with a great hall, I would gladly go there as your {reg0?wife:husband}, to be {reg0?mistress:keeper} of the household. But I do not wish to live like a hunted animal.

Elope with you? Yes -- we could do that. It is a great step to defy my family -- but a loveless marriage, and life without you, might be a far worse thing! But be warned -- this will be a terrible blow to my {s11}'s prestige, and {reg4?she:he} will do everything in {reg4?her:his} power to bring you down.
Quickly, then! There is no time to lose.
Everything in {reg4?her:his} power, you say? Em... Let me think about this...
Your lordship... Your ladyship... Would you like me to witness your exchange of vows?
Yes, do that. For my part, I make the following vow: I, {s4}, do swear that I accept {playername} as my {husband/wife}, according to the ancient law and custom of our land...
Very good. Do you, {playername}, swear similarly to accept {s4} as your {reg65?wife:husband}?
I do.
Eh, what? This is all moving too fast...
Oh, really? My dear -- I could never separate a {reg65?lady:young lad} from {reg65?her:his} family like that...
So I suppose our time together must come to an end...
Yes -- it must be...
Wait -- perhaps there is still a chance for us!
Farewell, {playername}. We will see each other, in the courts and castles of this realm, but we must keep our distance from each other. I will remember these days fondly, nonetheless.
In that case, we shall see what the future brings.
Always an honour to serve, {s65}.
I am {playername}.
My name is {playername}. At your service.
Of course. How splendid to finally make your acquaintance.
{playername}? I do not believe I've heard of you before.
I am about to retire for a little while, but perhaps we may have a chance to speak more later...
Now, if you will excuse me...
Can I help you with anything?
I want to know the location of someone.
Now, if you will excuse me...
Ještě něco dalšího?
I wished to ask about one of your relatives.
About which lord do you want information?
Your {s11} {s18}
Zapomeň na to.
Pardon, but I do not feel comfortable discussing such personal matters with you.

There's a trap set up for you in the town. {s3} ordered me to sacrifice one of my chosen warriors to fool the enemy, but he will just need to find another way.
Thank you, {Ser/my lady}. I will follow you to the gates of hell. But this would not be a good death.

My good {Ser/my lady}. Our lives at our village {s1} was unbearable. We worked all day long and still went to bed hungry. We are going to {s6} to start a new life, where we will be treated like humans.
You have gone against our laws by running from your bondage. You will go back to {s1} now!
Well, maybe you are right. All right then. If anyone asks, I haven't seen you.
All right {Ser/my lady}. As you wish. We'll head back to {s5} now.

{Změnil/Změnila} jsem názor. Vrať se zpět do vesnice!
Good. Go quickly now before I change my mind.

Well, if you are that eager to go, then go.

Good. Keep going.
Yes {Ser/my lady}. As you wish.

Good day, my {lord/lady}. Don't worry. If anyone asks, we haven't seen you.

This must be your unlucky day, mate. We're just about the worst people you could run into, in these parts.
Heh. For me, you are nothing more than walking money bags. A merchant in {s1} offered me good money for your heads.
A bounty hunter! Kill {him/her}! Kill {him/her} now!
What do you want? You want to pay us some more money?
Sorry to trouble you. I'll be on my way now.
Yeah. Stop fooling around and go make some money. I want to see that purse full next time I see you.
No. It's your turn to pay me this time.
What nonsense are you talking about? You want trouble? You got it.
We are the free brothers. We will fight only for ourselves from now on. Now give us your gold or taste our steel.
When I'm done with you, you'll regret ever leaving your army.
There's no need to fight. I am ready to pay for free passage.
I will give you money and good protection if you join my party.
Sounds like a good deal. To show us your good will, pay us {reg5} coins and we will join you.
All right here's your {reg5} coins.
I don't have that much money with me
Ok, we are at your service from now on.

Good. You are clever. Now, having a look at your baggage, I reckon a fellow like you could pretty easily afford {reg5} coins. We wouldn't want to be too greedy, now would we? Pay us, and then you can go.
All right here's your {reg5} coins.
I don't have that much money with me
Too bad. Then we'll have to sell you to the slavers.
Heh. That wasn't difficult, now, was it? All right. Go now.
Good day dear {friend/my lady}. How can I help you?
Ještě něco?
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}.

At last! My stock was almost depleted. I had paid the cost of the {s4} in advance. Here, take these {reg5} coins. That should cover your pay. And give {s9} my regards. I'll put in a good word for you next time I deal with him.
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost some of the cargo on the way.

Attacked by bandits eh? You are lucky they left you alive. Anyway, I can pay you no more than {reg5} coins for this. And I will let {s1} know that my order was delivered less than completely, so you will probably be charged for this loss.
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost the cargo on the way.
What? I was waiting for that {s4} for weeks! And now you are telling me that you lost it? You may rest assured that I will let {s1} know about this.
I'd like to buy every man who comes in here tonight a jar of your best {s0}.

Let everyone know of the generosity of {playername} to the people of {s10}.
Don't worry {s0}. Your name will be cheered and toasted here all night.
I'd like to buy me and my men a barrel of your best ale.

The price is fair enough, let my men have at it.
Don't worry {Ser/my lady}. Your men will enjoy their pints.
Actually, cancel that order.
Actually, cancel that order.
Have you heard of anyone in this realm who might have a job for a {man/woman} like myself?
Hmm... Well, {s10} is often looking for sellswords to fight in {reg0?her:his} wars.{s9}
Let me think some more...
I have heard that {s7} {s9}{s10} You may want to speak with {reg4?her:him}.

There may be other work, of course -- lords and guildmasters often have other tasks which we don't hear about. Also, the villages around here frequently need help, although they'd be more likely to pay you with a wedge of cheese and goodwill than with cold hard coins.
I'll keep my ears open for other opportunities. You may want to ask again from time to time.
I guess I should leave now.
Greetings to you, {s0}. You look like someone who should get to know me.
Why is that?

I broker ransoms for the poor wretches who are captured in these endless wars. Normally I travel between the salt mines and the slave markets on the coast, on commission from those whose relatives have gone missing. But if I'm out on my errands of mercy, and I come across a fellow dragging around a captive or two, well, there's no harm in a little speculative investment, is there? And you look like the type who might have a prisoner to sell.
What if their families can't pay?

Oh, then I spin them a few heartwarming tales of life on the galleys. You'd be surprised what sorts of treasures a peasant can dig out of his cowshed or wheedle out of his cousins, assuming he's got the proper motivation! And if in the end they cannot come up with the silver, then there are always slave merchants who are looking for galley slaves. One cannot do the Gods work with an empty purse, you see.
What can I get for a prisoner?

It varies. I fancy that I have a fine eye for assessing a ransom. There are a dozen little things about a man that will tell you whether he goes to bed hungry, or dines each night on soft dumplings and goose. The real money of course is in the gentry, and if you ever want to do my job you'll want to learn about every landowning family in the known world, their estates, their heraldry, their offspring both lawful and bastard, and, of course, their credit with the merchants.
Would you be able to ransom me if I were taken?
Of course. I'm welcome in every court. There's not many who can say that! So always be sure to keep a pot of coins buried somewhere, and a loyal servant who can find it in a hurry.
That's all I need to know. Thank you.
Greetings. If you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Anyway, if you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Then you'd better bring your purse. I have got prisoners to sell.
I want to sell all the prisoners I have with me.
Let's see...  I'll give you {reg0} coins for your {reg1} {reg2?prisoners:prisoner}.  Do we have a deal?
We have a deal.
Let me think about it again.
Tell me about what you do again.
I wish to ransom one of my companions.
Whom do you wish to ransom?

Let me check my ledger, here... Yes. Your friend is being held in the dungeon at {s7}. How interesting! I remember hearing that the rats down there are unusually large -- like mastiffs, they say... Now... For the very reasonable sum of {reg5} coins, which includes both the ransom and my commission and expenses, we can arrange it so that {s5} can once again enjoy {reg4?her:his} freedom. What do you say?
Here's your money.
I can't afford that right now.
Splendid! In a few days, I would think, you should find {s5} riding to rejoin you, blinking in the sunlight and no doubt very grateful! Is there any other way in which I can help you?

Of course, of course... Never mind what they say about the rats, by the way -- I've never actually seen one myself, on account of the pitch-black darkness. Anyway, I'm sure that {s5} will understand why it's important for you to control expenditures. Now... Was there anything else?
Not this time. Good-bye.
Let me see what you have...
I will be staying here for a few days. Let me know if you need my services.

Greetings, friend. You look like the kind of {man/person} who'd do well to know me. I travel a lot all across all the world and keep an open ear. I can provide you information that you might find useful. For a meager price of course.
Greetings, {playername}. I saw your companion {s10} at a tavern in {s11} some days ago. I thought you might like to know.
Thanks. I'll go and find {reg3?her:him} there.
Thanks, but I don't really care.
Greetings, {playername}.
Yes?
What can you tell me about this land?

The Free cities of Essos have been trying to eliminate each other since the Bleeding Years, more than three hundred years ago. Until recently, Westeros was ruled by a single king, but with Robert Baratheons death, the seven kingdoms have fragmented, with both his brothers and his son claiming the throne, and Robb Stark fighting for independence. I hear that the Dothraki have been causing trouble in the east, but I seldom travel that far, and either way, the Demon Road, the Ruins of Valyria and the Dothraki Sea make the journey dangerous. Only fools travel that way! Anyhow, at least the current chaos, gripping the world, must present an adventurer such as yourself with quite the opportunities. With some luck and skill, you can make a name for yourself here, amass a fortune perhaps, or gain great power. Opportunities are endless and so are the rewards, if you are willing to risk your life for them.
Tell me more about these opportunities.
Thank you. That was all I needed to know.
Well, you probably know everything I could tell you already. You seem to be doing pretty well.

The archons, kings, princes and lords will pay good money for sellswords if they are engaged in a war. If you have done a bit of fighting, speaking with one of their lords will probably result in being offered a sellsword contract. However the real rewards come if you can manage to become a vassal to a king or a lord. A vassal can own villages, castles and towns and get rich with the taxes and revenues of these estates. Normally, only nobles of the realm own land in this way, but in time of war, a king will not hesitate to accept someone who distinguishes {himself/herself} on the battlefield as a vassal, and grant {him/her} the right to own land.

It is not unheard-of for adventurers to renounce allegiance to king altogether, declare themselves kings, and claim land in their own name. This is a difficult path, however, as the great nobles of the land, with their long ancestries, are not likely to accept such upstarts as their liege. Such rulers would need to be very careful in establishing their right to rule, or they would be set upon from all sides.

It might be easier for an adventurer like yourself to pledge support to an existing king's rival.  There are many such pretenders in the world -- those who are born to the right family, who go around and stir up trouble saying they have a better claim to the throne than the current ruler. If those claim holders could find supporters, they could easily start civil wars and perhaps even replace the ruler one day.
Interesting. Where can I find these claim holders?
I guess I heard enough already. Thank you.

A claim holder's life would be in danger in his own country of course. Therefore, they usually stay at rival courts, raising support and hoping to find someone willing to champion their cause. I usually hear news about some of them, and may be able to tell you their location with some precision. But of course, I would ask for a little something for such a service.
I want to know the location of a claimant.
Whose location do you want to know?
Zapomeň na to.
I can reveal this information to you for a small price, let's say 30 silver coins.
All right. Here is 30 coins.
Zapomeň na to.

I am looking for book merchants...

I might have crossed paths with one or two recently. For 100 fine coins, I'll tell you where.

Zapomeň na to.
You can find them at {s11}.
I am looking for ransom brokers...
I am sorry I haven't run across any lately.
I know where they are. For 50 silver, I'll tell you.
All right. Here is 50 coins.

I am looking for one of my former employees...
Maybe I can help you. Who are you looking for?
My fomer chamberlain, {s11}.
My fomer constable, {s11}.
My fomer chancellor, {s11}.

I will send word to {reg0?her:him} that you are looking for {reg0?her:him}.

I guess I know where {s15} is. For 30 coins, I'll tell you.

Farewell.
Greetings. They say you're the kind of {man/woman} who'd be interested to hear that I travel frequently to {s17}. I'll tell you all I know for a mere 100 coins.
Here's 100 coins. Tell me what you know.
Sorry friend. I am not interested.
Well, that's all I can tell you. Good bye.
Good day, will you be looking at my books?
Yes. Show me what you have for sale.
Of course.
Ještě něco?
Nothing. Thanks.

Good day my friend, I have some unidentified items with me. I will sell these items to you by the base price of them. You probably buy an item with a good prefix by a low price or buy an item with a bad prefix by a hight price. Do you want to try your fortune?
That sounds good. I want to have a try.
Which type do you want to check?
Weapons.

Which one?
{s1}(price: {reg1}).
Let me see something else.
Ještě něco?
No, I must leave now.
Hail and well met. I am Master Grazmak mo Senko, of the great city of Astapor, most favoured of the great Harpy, the jewel of the east and heir to the Ghiscari Empire!
Greetings. Where is Astapor?

Astapor lies in Slaver's Bay, close to the Isle of Cedars. The Good Masters, of whom I am amongst, deal with the most magnificent soldiers in the world, the Unsullied! Trained from childhood, they're the fiercest, most stalwart, most loyal soldiers in the world! None might stand before them! Being the barbarian that you are, I imagine that you are not familiar with the story of the Three Thousand of Qohor? Khal Temmo and his khalasar was defeated by three thousand Unsullied. Only four hundred remained at the end of the battle, but Khal Temmo was dead and so was all his sons and twelve thousand of his warriors!
I see. You're selling slave soldiers. If they're really that good, why are they not part of every army in the world?

Bah! Petty lords and knights, would-be kings and princes, filthy khals and greedy magisters, they do not understand warfare. They think any soldier is the same. The Unsullied training starts a age five and is from dawn to dusk. It is brutal, designed not only to teach them how to fight, but to strip away all individuality, empathy, and self-worth. Only one in three survive, and those that fail at any stage are killed. They are fully castrated - penis and testicles cut - and their manhoods burned at the altar of the Lady of Spears. They regularly consume an elixir called the Wine of Courage to deaden their sensitivity to pain. They will obey every command, even fall on their sword should you wish it.
You have roused my interest Master Grazmak, what can you offer me?

Usually, we sell Unsullied by the century, so as to not split them up. They have a tendency to become fat and bloated. Keeping them together ensures that their discipline and fighting prowess keeps. However, I have heard worrying news from the east, talk of dragons and brimstones. So I am looking to settle down in this area and as such will only be able to sell Unsullied in small groups.
Hello again, {playername}.
I'd like to hire some Unsullied.
I'd like you to take up residence at my place and instruct young recruits about your way of warfare.
I would like you to take up residence somewhere else.
Can you tell me the history of Slaver's Bay?

When the Doom came to Valyria, the ancient and proud cities of Astapor, Meereen and Yunkai rose once again to prominence. We deal in slaves, and it has made us rich and powerful. The Meereenese train slaves of all sorts, while the Yunkai specialize in bedslaves. In Astapor, we train the Unsullied, the heirs of the lockstep legions of Old Ghis. Further to the south, New Ghis claims to be the true heir to the Ghiscari Empire, but I say it is we, the masters of Astapor, who are the true descendants of Grazdan the Great!
Tell me your story again.
Goodbye.
I have {reg1?{reg1}:none} Unsullied available for hire at the moment. {reg1?Each recruit costs 800 coins to hire. How many do you want to hire?:}
{reg0}
Zapomeň na to.
Ještě něco?

Abandon the freedom that comes with roaming the taverns of these lands, and only train brave young men from your lands? You'll have to provide all the equipment, the training grounds, the tutor fees, and of course a little extra for the right to have me at your court. If you want me to stay at your court, it will cost you {reg1} coins per month.
You drive a hard bargain, but I'm sure you're worth it.
A wise decission. I'll pack my gear and move to your court.
It seems that you have no hall of your own. I'll wait for you in a tavern of your choice until that is resolved.
Where would you like me to go?
Wait at my court for me.
Greetings to you, {most noble lord/most noble lady}.
What is it you do?
I have some questions about courtship.
Can you teach me any songs?

I can teach you the song, 'The Storming of the Castle of Love.' It is short enough to be easily learned. It is an allegoric poem, replete with symbols and metaphor. It describes how a brave prince from the Stormlands wins the heart of his lady by learning the virtues of chivalry, becoming a true and noble knight. Its theme -- that the role of a woman is to inspire but also civilize a man -- is appreciated by some noble ladies, but not all.

I can teach you the song, 'The Maidens Desire.' It is a lyrical poem, which can be interpreted either erotically or spiritually. The lover realizes the majesty of the Seven by gazing upon the body of his beloved. I believe that it appeals to women of a certain romantic temperament, but you risk scandalizing or boring others.

I can teach you the tragic ballad of the Rains of Castamere. It's a fairly recent song, commisioned by Lord Tywin Lannister after his victory over the rebellious lords Reyne and Tarbeck. They denounced their allegiance to the old Lord Paramount of the Westerlands, Tytos Lannister, but his son and heir Ser Tywin soon had them regretting their pride.

I can teach you part of the song of Florian and Jonquil. It is a heroic tale, full of blood and battle. Florian the Fool sees the highborn maiden Jonquil bathing in the pool near Maidenpool. He is taken with her, but sadly she is promised to marry the King of the Rivers and Hills, a vain and cruel man. Knowing that he will never be allowed to even kiss her, Florian challenges the arrogant king to a battle of arms and wits for the hand of fair Jonquil.

I can teach you the song The Bear and the Maiden Fair. It's a rather ribald song, mostly enjoyed in Westeros by lowborn and highborn alike. It describes in a humorous tone the story of three boys, a bear and a goat going to a fair, where the bear rescues a young innocent maiden who was hoping for a knight.
To teach it to you, I will need some hours of your time -- and, of course, a small fee for my services. About 300 silver coins would suffice.
I believe you already know the songs I am best equipped to teach.
Yes -- teach me that one
Zapomeň na to.
Very well -- repeat after me:^   I deflected her skeptical questioning darts^   with armor made of purest devotion^   purged in the fire of my heart^   from the slag of any baser emotion

Very well -- repeat after me:^   You are the first and the last^   the outer and the inner^   When I drink from the cup of love^   I escape the tread of time^   A moment in solitude with you^   Would have no beginning and no end

Very well -- repeat after me:^  And who are you, the proud lord said,^  that I must bow so low?^  Only a cat of a different coat,^  that's all the truth I know.^  In a coat of gold or a coat of red,^  a lion still has claws,^  And mine are long and sharp, my lord,^  as long and sharp as yours.

Very well -- repeat after me:^   A light pierced the gloom over Maidenpool...^   Where charge of surf broke on smooth shore^   Fair haired the maiden stood^   Amidst the sapphire pool^   Over chirp of bird, of leaf and grass^   The fool looked on in wonder.

Very well -- repeat after me:^   A bear there was, A bear, A BEAR!^   All black and brown, And covered with hair!^   Oh come they said, Oh come to the fair!^   The fair? said he, But I'm a bear!^   All black and brown, And covered in hair!?^   And down the road, from here to there,^   From here! To there! Three boys, a goat,^   And a dancing bear!
'I deflected her skeptical questioning darts...'
'You are the first and the last..'
'And who are you, the proud lord said,'
'A light pierced the gloom over Maidenpool...'
'A bear there was, A bear, A BEAR!'
Pshaw... What kind of doggerel is that?

Very well. If the song is not to your taste, then keep your coin. But remember -- with poets and with lovers, what is important is not what pleases you. What is important is what your pleases your audience. If you wish to learn the poem, I am still willing to teach.
Very good -- but there are many stanzas to go. Now, listen closely...
Can you tell me anything about the eligible maidens in this realm?
About whom did you wish to know?
Just tell me the latest piece of gossip
Zapomeň na to.
{reg0?She:He} is married to you, of course! Clearly, no one would dream that {reg0?she:he} would do anything to engender gossip.
Very interesting -- but let us speak of something else.
Very interesting -- is there any more news?
What? I'll make that miscreant face my sword
Do you mean that? {s11} will be honor-bound to fight you, but challenging a lord to duel over a woman is seen as a bit hot-headed, even in this warlike age.
Yes -- I intend to force {s11} to relinquish his suit of {s12}
No -- I let my passions run away with me, there
As you wish. I'll spead the word of your intentions, so that {s13} does not try to back out...
Do you know of any ongoing feasts?
Good-bye.
What do you wish to know?
Can I answer any other questions for you?
Is there a place for me in the game of love?
How would a suitor meet a lady?
Having met a lady, how would the suitor woo her?
Tell me about marriage and love among the nobility

Nobles are an odd lot. A daughter is a political asset, to be given away to a lord with whom her father wishes to make an alliance. Yet the great families of this land idealize pure love between man and woman, and I have seen many a hardened warrior weep copious tears at the doomed ardour of Jonquil and Florian in the songs -- even as he made plans to break his own daughter's heart.

Fathers differ, of course. Some nobles will let their daughters choose a husband who pleases them. Others, however, feel that to allow their daughters any choice at all would be to diminish their own authority, and insist on imposing a groom whether she likes it or not.

But the majority will steer a middle course -- they will want to make the final decision about a groom, but will weigh their daughter's preferences heavily. Among other factors, a happy marriage is more likely to produce heirs. So, there is a place for courtship, and for the use of skill and passion to win a lady's heart.
What if a lady and her father disagree about a suitor?

It happens sometimes that a bride elopes. This is a major blow to the father's prestige, leading to lasting enmities. Indeed, it is possible that a war may be fought over a woman. Now, that is a fine topic for a song.

In the end, however, most brides will submit to their parents' choice. A noblewoman's family is everything to her, and few are brave enough to risk its disapproval for the sake of man she barely knows. She may pine for her lover, but still accept the groom -- and without tragic love, what would we have to sing about?

Of course! Highborn ords make a great deal of lineage, but in the end, lands and money speak louder than one's ancestors. Even though you are a foreigner, if you are coming up in the world, then many parents will consider you a fine catch.

You will have to compete with many other lords of your realm, however, who will have an advantage -- they have known these ladies from childhood, and will have been sized up as grooms by carefully discerning mothers and aunts. Some ladies may be fascinated by the stranger, yet opt for the familiar.

So know this -- you may have your heart broken. But to enter the arena of love fearing heartbreak is like entering the battlefield fearing the enemy's arrows. Be brave, and shrug off the sting of rejection, and victory may yet be yours.

I will speak bluntly. Most of the {ladies/lords} of this land are looking for a demure {lad/maiden}, whose skin as fair as snow -- and your skin is burnt brown by the sun. They want a {boy/maiden} whose voice is soft as bells -- and your voice is hoarse from commanding {soldiers/men} in battle. Also, although the {ladies/lords} of this realm appreciate poems about love, most also want heirs, and few {men/women} can ride and fight while {caring for their children/with child}.

However, not all {ladies/lords} will be so conventionally minded. We poets sing of shield {boys/maidens} and of {hunters/huntresses}, of {lads/women} who forged their own path without having sacrificed the chance for love. I would not tell you that it would be easy for you to find a devoted {wife/husband} who will accept your ways, but I would not say that it is impossible.
What advantage is there in seeking a {wife/husband}?

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may forge a strong alliance with the bride's family, and a wife may also assist you in manipulating the politics of the realm to your advantage.
What's more, most of the great families have at some point intermarried with royalty, which would boost your own claim to rule -- should you ever choose to assert it...

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may have access to the groom's castles and properties, and be able to work with him to advance both of your standings in the realm.

Every so often, a king or great lord will hold a feast. In towns they will often be accompanied by jousting and a melee, and in castles they will be accompanied by hunts. The feasts provide a chance for the lords to repair some of the rivalries that may undermine the strength of the realm. They also provide an opportunity for families to show off their eligible daughters, and ladies will often be allowed to mingle unsupervised with the guests.

If you have the opportunity, you may attempt to pay the lady a compliment. This indicates to her that you are a potential suitor, and she will usually know if she wishes you to continue your suit. Incidentally, if you come to her fresh from having distinguished yourself in the tourney or in the hunt, then you may make a stronger first impression than otherwise.

To woo a lady takes a certain amount of time and patience, and several meetings spaced over a period of months. A lady who is interested in you will often find ways of letting you know if she wishes you to come visit her. Alternately, you may simply go and ask her father or brother for permission. If you do not have permission from her guardian, it may be possible to arrange an assignation through other means.

Having arranged an assignment, you may then attempt to charm her and win her favor. Perhaps one of the most difficult aspects of this is finding a topic of conversation. Most noblewomen lead a cloistered life, at least until they are married, and thus will have little to say that will interest you. On other hand, she will soon tire of hearing of your own deeds in the outside world.

One time-tested mode of courtship is simply to recite a popular poem, and discuss it. This way, you are both on an equal footing, and neither will have an advantage in knowledge or experience. Of course, different ladies will have different tastes in poetry.

At some point, you will be able to discuss directly the issue of marriage. She will then let you know if you measure up to what she wants in a husband. Some ladies will coolly assess who is the most prestigious of her suitors, others will be guided by their passions. Some will look to your companions, to see whether you are the kind of husband who will treat her as an equal, while others will follow the lead of their fathers.

At any rate, it is a challenging business -- and do not forget, you may find that your suit prospers with a lady, only to have it falter on a father's political ambitions. So you must ask yourself: are you willing to risk disappointment and heartbreak? Alternately, are you willing to throw away your standing in society, to make enemies of allies, in pursuit of a forbidden love? Because if you are, then perhaps some day we will write poems about you.
What is it that you poets and musicians do again?

I compose and write songs for the lords of the land, and their ladies. Sometimes I sing about war, sometimes about the virtues of kings, and sometimes, for the more sophisticated audiences, about the virtues of wine. For most audiences, however, I sing of love.
No, that is all.
Do you have any other questions?
Is there anything else?
{reg0?Your highness:My {lord/lady}}, we are in dire need of assistance.  Will you hear my plea?
{My lord/Madam}, you look like a {man/lady} of the sword and someone who could help us. Will you hear my plea?
What is the matter, my good {reg65?woman:man}?
What are you burbling about peasant? Speak out.

A band of brigands have taken refuge in our village. They take everything we have, force us to serve them, and do us much evil. If one of us so much as breathes a word of protest, they kill the poor soul on the spot right away. Our lives have become unbearable. I risked my skin and ran away to find someone who can help us. Please {s0}, you are a {man/lady} of valor and a fearsome warrior, with many friends and soldiers at your service. If there is anyone who can help us, it's you.

A band of brigands have taken refuge in our village. They take everything we have, force us to serve them, and do us much evil. If one of us so much as breathes a word of protest, they kill the poor soul on the spot right away. Our lives have become unbearable. I risked my skin and ran away to find someone who can help us.
Why don't you go to the {reg0?mistress:lord} of your village? {reg0?She:He} should take care of the vermin.

Our {reg0?lady:lord} is imprisoned, so we cannot go to {reg0?her:him} for protection. Please {s0}, you {reg1?are:look like} a {man/lady} of valor, {reg1?with:and you have no doubt} many friends and soldiers at your service.  If there is anyone who can help us, it's you.

We have no lord, so we cannot go to him for protection. Please {s0}, you {reg1?are:look like} a {man/lady} of valor, {reg1?with:and you have no doubt} many friends and soldiers at your service.  If there is anyone who can help us, it's you.

I did, {s0}, but our {reg0?lady:lord}'s {reg0?servants:men} did not let me see {reg0?her:him} and said {reg0?she:he} was occupied with more important matters and that we should deal with our own problem ourselves. Please {s0}, you {reg1?are:look like} a {man/lady} of valor and a fearsome warrior, {reg1?with:and you have no doubt} many friends and soldiers at your service.  If there is anyone who can help us, it's you.
Very well, I'll help you. Where is this village?
I can't be bothered with this right now.
Why would I fight these bandits? What's in it for me?
God bless you, {s0}. Our village is {s7}. It is not too far from here.
As you say {Ser/my lady}. Forgive me for bothering you.

We are but poor farmers {s0}, and the bandits have already got most of what we have on this world. but we'll be glad to share with you whatever we have got. And we'll always be in your gratitude if you help us.
Thank you for helping us {s0}. Crush those bandits!
This one serves.
Go away.
Henujagon jaelza lua vala mirre henujagon kostas.
Yes?
If you wish to speak to the queen, you must wash yourself. Such a foul smell coming off of you.
It really is quite disgusting.
Who are you?
I am Reznak mo Reznak, seneschal to our beloved queen.
I thought Meereen was ruled by the Great Masters?
Yes, yes, but in her greatness, Queen Daenerys has decreed that the Great Masters will no longer have a say in the ruling of the city.
Goodbye.
Really, take a bath.
Ano, co chceš?
I assume you're here to pay homage to the queen?
Well?
I am!
Very well then. I've been told that you Westerosi have your own vows you swear to signal fealty.
You'll need to swear fealty to her Grace.
Approach her, and then say the words.
Goodbye.
Meereen will prosper under the rule of Queen Daenerys.
Zhavvorsa vadakhera ma hrazef ma vaf akkate.
Anha ray char m'ave yeri lajakoon hakeso.
Kash qoy qoyi thira disse.
Aeksio yne iliritas.
Skoros otapa?
Ano, co chceš?
Who are you?
You have the honor to be adressing Hizdahr zo Loraq, of the ancient and noble House of Loraq
Can you tell me about the House of Loraq?
Very well. We are an ancient and illustrious house.
In our veins flow the blood of Mazdhan zo Loraq, Hazrak zo Loraq, Zharaq zo Loraq and Grazdan the Great, who founded the Ghiscari Empire.
Our family was old when Valyria was yet nothing but a cluster of shepherds huts.
Goodbye.
Meereen must move forward.
Yn aderi, mori, aot mazili se henkiri ilvi biarvi manaerili.
Urnet luo buzdaro tolvio belma pryjatas!
Zaldrizes buzdari iksos daor!
Vala mhysa syt robra derebza.
I obey!
Move aside!
Move along!
Yunkai is great!
Yes?
Who are you?
I am Khrazz!
What is this place?
Pits made for fighting!
The dragon queen has closed the pits though. Khrazz used to sleep on silk cushions, and eat liver every day. Now he sleeps on straw, and eat stale bread.
But Hizdahr zo Loraq has promised to have the pits opened again.
Goodbye.
Khrazz must train.
Gusela!
Epses! Gadbag!
The great Morghaz zo Zherzyn would like you to get out of his way.
Ima vi nejo emi hubre, si hin kizir sizi, gimin sko oo jelevre tuzis ji gunjda emi begisto dos!
The great Chezdhar zo Rhaezn would like to inquire whether you forgot to wash your face.
Ima vi nejo emi hubre!
My master, Faezhar zo Faez, would like you to know that your face is less than pleasing to him.
What does it want?
I am {playername}. Who are you?
I am Grazdan mo Eraz, one of the great Wise Masters of Yunkai, and envoy to the Volantenes, whom I will soon visit on my errand to bring them over to our cause.
Which cause is that?

The dragon whore has disrupted the slave trade, pillaged Meereen and even now feasts her dragons on the flesh of new born children. She impales anyone who defies her on spikes to die, and she bathes in the blood of virgins to keep her youthfull apperance. It is said that she became accustomed to bedding horses during her time with the Dothraki, and now no man can satisfy her.

Even so, she is said to take a new lover each night, and those who fail to please her is feed to her dragons. She is a vile harlot, and so we Yunkai'i must put a stop to her ways. A great army will be gathered, legions from New Ghis are on their way, the Wise Masters have raised many well-trained soldiers, and if the Gods favour us, the Volantenes will aid our cause.
Your cause is doomed!
Dyni!
Your cause is just!
Rigle!
Gusela!
My master, the great Grazdan mo Eraz, is a very skilled lover, he brings me to the brink of pleasure every night.
The great Grazdan mo Eraz is a most valiant warrior and a great general. He would surely have adverted the destruction of Astapor, had he been in charge.
Pst! Over here! A good day to you, my friend. I am Gramnan. I trade in rare and valuable spices, fit for kings!
Allow me to show you my fine wares. Rest assured, any spice I offer you is of the utmost quality, I swear it by the gods! May they strike me down right this moment should a lie touch my tongue!
I would like to buy some spices.
Not today, good merchant, I have other matters to which I must attend.

Ah, {playername}, you are a most gentle, noble and handsome person! These spices will prolong your life, and make you irresistible to all the men and women of the land! I sell saffron, cinnamon and nutmeg, and a pound costs only 500 coins!
I will take a pound of saffron.
I will take a pound of cinnamon.
I will take a pound of nutmeg.
Actually, cancel that order.
A good day to you, my friend. I am Gora, the illustrious adventurer! You look a mighty warrior, I have just the thing for you!

On a journey to the cursed city of Mantarys, I found three valyrian swords! The inscription shows that they belonged to the great scions of Ghis, Mazdhan the Magnificent, Hazrak the Handsome and Zharaq the Liberator!
I would like to buy one of these swords.

Ah, {playername}, you are a most gentle, noble and handsome person! These swords will make you unbeatable in any fight! I can be persuaded to sell each sword for as little as 10000 coins! I know, it's a crime, but you have such an honest face!
I will take the sword that belonged to Mazdhan.
I will take the sword that belonged to Hazrak.
I will take the sword that belonged to Zharaq.
Actually, cancel that order.
Urnet luo buzdaro tolvio belma pryjatas!
Dorior darion udrirzi mijessis.
Olvie hen embraro tolmiot nykelot avy ivestragon issa.
Vala egromy robir ezimza.
Co chceš?
Aeksiot zyhon vaoreznon jepin, se ziksoso udlissis!
Jomozussis lua vala mirros engoso ydrassigon kostilos daor.
A good day to you, my friend. I am Gessala. I trade in rare spices, from all over the world. From Asshai to Qarth, Zamettar to Great Moraq, if they grow it, I sell it.
Allow me to show you my fine wares. Rest assured, any spice I offer you is of the utmost quality.
I would like to look at the spices from Asshai.
I would like to look at the spices from Qarth
I would like to look at the spices from Zamettar.
I would like to look at the spices from Great Moraq.
Not today, good merchant, I have other matters to which I must attend.

Ah, but of course, {playername}, you are a discerning indvidual, and with taste. Asshai produces fine spice. I offer three destinct spices from the Shadow Lands. Fine saffron, exquisite myrrh and sweet cinnamon. A pound costs 600 coins.
I will take a pound of saffron.
I will take a pound of myrrh.
I will take a pound of cinnamon.
Actually, cancel that order.

Ah, but of course, {playername}, you are a person of fine taste, and Qarth produces some of the best spice. I offer three destinct spices from that most ancient of cities. Fine saffron, exquisite pepper and sweet cardamom. A pound costs 400 coins.
I will take a pound of saffron.
I will take a pound of pepper.
I will take a pound of cardamom.
Actually, cancel that order.

Ah, but of course, {playername}, the spicers from Zamettar are known throughout for their fine products. I offer three destinct spices from that most exotic of ports. Fine nutmeg, exquisite curry and sweet anise. A pound costs 600 coins.
I will take a pound of nutmeg.
I will take a pound of curry.
I will take a pound of anise.
Actually, cancel that order.

Ah yes, Great Moraq. A fine choice, {playername}, Great Moraq is truly the spice capital of the world. I offer three destinct spices from that most exotic and dangerous island of dangers. Fine cloves, exquisite spiceflower and sweet persimmon seeds. A pound costs 200 coins.
I will take a pound of cloves.
I will take a pound of spiceflower.
I will take a pound of persimmon seeds.
Actually, cancel that order.
Hash yer ray tih loy alegra, zhey vikeesi?
Eyel varthasoe she ilekaan rikhoya arrekaan vekha vosi yeroon vosma tolorro!
Hmph!
Hash tihi vekhi she nhare yeroon?
Water... please...
I'm busy!
Yes?
Watch the monkeys!
Gods, I hate these places.
There's no good whores in Volon Therys!
Eveth...
Vesterozia?
Yes?
Jeva jumuzugon?
No?
Meri mozugon?
Yes?
Mazoregon!
Nadinagon nuspes!
Qiloni pilos lue vale tolvie ossenatas!
Rine dore odrikatas!
Munar aot teptas lue brozi, ia mirre tolie iderebas.
Aeksiot zyhon vaoreznon jepin, se ziksoso udlissis.
Zaldrizes buzdari iksos daor.
Yes, what is it?
You speak the common tongue?
Yes, of course I do. I was born and raised in Ashford.
What are you doing here in Slaver's Bay then?

Selling my sword. I'm a sellsword. Was a member of the Long Lances, but my horse died. Gylo Rhegan apparently has no need for horseless horsemen, so here I am, walking across a damned desert, guarding these savages. Should have stayed in Ashford. Nothing here but sand and slaves.
Goodbye.
Brzy dorazíme do Meereenu.
Azanty drejikydho dyni!
Gundjabo?
Prosím?
Hilagho? Pindhago skoverdi tala live?
Gusela!
Yes?
Yes?
Zzzz...
Zzzz...
What?
What?
Yes?
How can I be of service?
Ano?
Co tu dělá člověk z Dorne?
What's it to you?
I'm busy!
Vesterozia?
Promiňte?
Rysta! Odabagon nejo live lerraska?
Ano?
Krimvo!
Ne?
Ima vi nejo emi hubre!
Gusela!
Ano, co chceš?
Kdy dorazíme do Volantisu?
Budeme tam brzy, {playername}. Vítr je silný a máme dobrý čas.
Odkud jste?
Braavos! Narozen a vychován. Upřímně, dělá se mi zle z obchodování s těmihle tlustými obchodníky s otroky v Otrokářském zálivu. Ale možná Dračí královna učiní přítrž těm jejich odporným obchodům.
Díky za váš čas, kapitáne.
We'll reach Volantis soon.
Hmph!
What do you want?!
Ano, ano, co chceš?
S čím chce obchodovat v Yunkai?
Nehodlám tam obchodovat, ale dokážu si představit kapitána jako jednoho z těch jejich otroků. Měli jsme jet do Astaporu prodat slonovinu, ale to by očividně byla pošetilost.
Co se stalo v Astaporu?

Slýcháme zvěsti už pár týdnů. Drak se snesl na město! Velký, šupinatý a s pevnými prsy! Nejpitomější věc jakou jsem kdy slyšel. Na druhou stranu, ale člověk co to vyprávěl nemluvil jinak, než dothracky, čemuž jsem už vůbec nerozuměl. Musel jsem si ten příběh domýšlet z pohybu jeho rukou. Každopádně bych rád viděl draka, i když má prsa...
Díky za váš čas.
Can't wait to get into town, haven't had a drink for days.
Hmph!
Ano?
Byl jste někdy ve Valyrii?
Hah! Ne, můj příteli, ne. A nikdy se tam ani nepodívám.
Proč ne?
Ty prokleté ostrovy jsou plné démonů. Slyšel jsem to od děvky, které šoustala s obchodníkem, jehož bratr tam byl. Velcí démoni, kteří požírají duše! Ne díky, toho se ušetřím.
Díky za váš čas.
Can't wait to get out of this fog. Makes me shiver.
What do you want?!
I'm busy!
Ano?
Co se stane s otroky, když se loď potopí?
Utopí se, předpokládám. Vlastně mi jsou vcelku ukradení.
Proč?
Někteří byli zrozeni k tomu, být otroky, někteří k tomu, být pány. Nejsem otrok, to tedy znamená, že musím být pánem, eh. Možná nejsem kapitán lodi, ale aspoň nejsem otrok.
Díky za váš čas.
Can't wait to get into port. Been dying to have myself a whore.
Cože?
Hodně si se děvkařil?
He, celý můj život. Na světě není nic lepšího, než si koupit ženskou a ukázat jí, kdo je tady pánem.
Ano, musí se naučit, kde je jejich místo!
To teda!
Řekl bych, že ti, kteří si kupují děvky, si nejsou schopni najít ženu, která by jim dala zadarmo.
Ah! Co ty o tom víš?
Hmph!
Yarr, co po mě chceš?
Jsem {playername}. Kdo jste vy?
Kapitán Bayle Neres, pán Pikantní dívky, nejrychlejší lodi v tomhle přístavu.
Kam máte namířeno?

Směrem do Yunkai s kořením, skvělým vínem a slonovinou. Máme volnou kajutu, pokud se k nám chceš přidat. Cesta je dlouhá a nebezpečná a poplujeme blízko Valyrie, ale je zde velká příležitost k zisku. Kajuta však není levná, bude tě to stát 2000 zlatých.
Dobrá, tady jsou peníze.
To je příliš!
Dobrá tedy, vyplouváme okamžitě!
Skvělé!
Omluvte mě.
Ah, {playername}!
Zdravím, kapitáne. Je šance, že se poplavíte směrem na Yunkai v brzké době?
Vskutku ano, {playername}.
Nepředpokládám, že máte volnou kajutu?
Ale ano mám, mám! Bude tě to stát 4000, pokud se chceš dostat do Yunkai.
Dobrá, tady jsou peníze.
To je příliš!
Dobrá tedy, vyplouváme okamžitě!
Skvělé!
Omluvte mě.
Ano, co se děje?
Kdy dorazíme do Yunkai?
Chvíli to potrvá, {playername}. Nejprve musíme proplout přes Valyrii.
Slyšel jsem námořníky mluvit o nějaké Záhubě. Můžete mi říct víc?

Lidé tvrdí, že Záhuba se stále drží nad Valyrii. Cokoliv to znamená. Vše co vím je, že většinu výprav, která se dostane příliš blízko k ruinám, už nikdy nikdo nespatřil. Říká se, že velké prázdné síně dračích pánů obývají démoni.
Díky za váš čas, kapitáne.
The wind should pick up soon, I can feel it in my bones.
Ano?
Co je tahle nepřirozená mlha?
Prokletí Valyrie.
Řekněte mi víc.

Valyria byla kdysi spojena s pevninou Essosu. Když ale přišla Záhuba, hory se rozštěpili vedví a chrlily obrovské množství roztavené horniny. Obrovské zemětřesení ničilo kontinent a moře se vřítilo do Valyrie a přeměnilo ji v souostroví. Hory Čtrnácti ohňů Valyrie jsou teď potopeny, ale i přesto jejich plameny stále žnou a moře se nad nimi vypařuje.
Díky za váš čas.
This fog is horrible. Monsters and pirates could lurk in it.
Ano, {playername}?
Kdy dorazíme do Yunkai?
Už to nebude dlouho trvat.
Můžete mi něco říct o Yunkai?

Yunkai je známé také jako Žluté město. Leží na východním pobřeží Otrokářského zálivu, blízko ostrova Yaros. Yunkai je proslulý výcvikem a prodejem otroků do postele. Všichni ti otroci se učí Způsobům sedmi vzdechů a Šestnáct sedel potěšení.  Jednoho z nich si také musím koupím, už je to dlouho co jsem naposledy měl ženu.
Díky za váš čas, Bayle.
We should be able to see the Island of Yaros soon.
Zdravím! Vítejte ve Šťastném přístavu!
Kdo jste?
Jsem Meralyn, ale lidé mě nazývají Merry. Mám největší pár prsou tady v Braavosu a já a moje dívky tu činíme mnoho snů skutečností.
Rád bych se na ty tvá prsa podíval.
Je mi líto, ale už jsem příliš mnoho let strávila na zádech. Můžeš se podívat jestli je volná Lanna. Je jí čtrnáct, je to čerstvá květinka. Je drahá, ale stojí za všechno to zlato, to ti slibuji!
Podívám se, jestli ji najdu.
Nebuď na ni hrubý. Chudák děvče má stále sny o romantice.
Hmpfh!
Omluvte mě.
I'm on my way out to buy some oysters.
Ano, zlatíčko?
Kdo jsi?
Jsme jedna z Merryiných dívek. Lanna je má dcera. Oh páni, vypadá to jako, že máš {pořádně velký penis/opravdu krásná prsa}.
No, to tedy mám!
Chtě{l/la} by sis mě přehnout? Je to levné, pouze 5 zlatých. Samozřejmě si mě musíš nejprve vzít. Nejsem žádná děvka! Jeden ze septonů nahoře nám udělá obřad, vždy ho provedou.
Tak tedy nahoru, ženo.
Promiň, nemůžu si tě dovolit.
Ale jistě, {manželi/ženo}, vezmi mě do postele. Jsem tvá červenající se nevěsta.
Hmpfh!
Omluv mě.
I'm much too sore for you, big man.
Ahoj, moje jméno je Lanna, kdo jsi?
Jsem {playername}.
Ahoj {playername}! Merry a matka říkají, že mám být zdvořilá a ostražitá ke každému muži, co sem vejde! Ale ne v ložnici, hihi.
Zaujala jsi mě. Pojďme nahoru.
Oh, nejprve zaplatit! Merry říká, že je má cena třikrát vyšší než u ostatních žen tady! Zaplať 840 zlatých a můžeš si se mnou dělat co budeš chtít!
Dobrá, tady jsou peníze.
Promiň Lanno, nemůžu si tě dovolit.
{Můj pane/Má paní}! Jsi tak {štědrý/štědrá}! Můžeš předstírat, že jsem pouhé děvče, hihi!
Dobře.
Omluv mě.
I'm too numb to work right now, sweetheart.
Ano?
Jsem {playername}, má paní. Můžeš mi o sobě něco prozradit?

Oh, {playername}, ty nejsi odsud, že ne? Lidé z Braavosu mě nazývají dcerou soumraku. Jsem kurtizána, což je hezké označení pro děvku. Jediný rozdíl mezi mnou a těmi děvčaty okolo je ten, že já si vybírám své milence a také jsem jsem mnohem zkušenější než ony.
Zdáš se upřímná na, ehm, paní noci.

Co bych měla říct nebo udělat? Můžu lichotit svým milencům, smát se jejich hloupým vtipům a říct jim, jak se mi z ni třesou kolena. Ale takové triky jsou spíš pro ženy jako je Bellegere nebo Královna Mermaid. Já mužům říkám krutou pravdu světa a platí mi za to stejně dobře, jako za to co mám mezi nohama. Tuším, že to Bellegere dělá také, ale není tím známá.
Má paní, vaše upřímnost je osvěžující.
Dáma by měla být vidět, ne slyšet!

Jsem si jistá že ano, {playername}, stejně jako si jsem jistá, že by sis {uřízl/uřízla} vlastní ruku, aby ses {dostal/dostala} na to mokré místo mezi mýma nohama. Bohužel teď mám milence, se kterým si to užívám. Kdyby ne hned bych tě vzala nahoru do mých komnat. Máš takový uličnický obličej, co se mi líbí.
Tedy se s vámi loučím, má paní.
Omluv mě.
I'm afraid I cannot talk right now, I'm trying to deduce some events.
Můžu pomoci?
I'm {playername}, my lady. Might I have the honor of knowing more about you?
The common people of Braavos call me the Black Pearl, and talk in secret of my wicked ways and illustrious ancestors. My real name is Bellegere Otherys.
Who are your illustrious ancestors?

Oh, one of the Targaryen kings. Aegon the Unlikely to be frank, which does put a damper on the illustrious part. He sowed his seed with more vigor than most farmers, and had a crop to match. Say, {playername}, are you looking to make a name for yourself? I can help you along, in return for a favor. I am, by far, the most powerful woman in Braavos, adored by the common folk and lusted after by the princes. A kiss from me would put your name on everyones lips, and your name would become common knowledge in the city. All I ask in return is that you keep in mind the favor you owe me, to be repaid at a later date.
I should conquer Valyria for a kiss from you, my lady!
My lady, I fear I cannot be in debt to a woman as lovely as you!
Very well then, {playername}, meet me by the balcony. The light will make both of us look lovely, and my dress becomes positively transparent in such light, if you stand close to me.
Right!
Excuse me.
I'm afraid I have an audience with the Iron Bank soon, {playername}, and I have to prepare myself.
Hi there, welcome to the Peach.
Who are you?
I'm one of the girls working here. My mother used to work here too. My name is Bella, I'm named for the battle.
Which battle was that?

Oh, the Battle of the Bells. When the king hid here, Lord Connington came to root him out. But then the lords Stark, Tully and Arryn descended on the town, and they defeated the army of the Mad King! Leslyn says my mother was the kings favorite, and that he rung her bell more than any of the other girls. Makes me the kings bastard daughter I suppose. Anyhow, you can have me for 3 silver.
I've never slept with a kings bastard before. Let's go upstairs.
I'm sorry, I'm busy.
Oh my yes! My royal blood is all fiery!
Hmpfh!
Excuse me.
I have to go help the Huntsman with his dogs. Visit me later!
Yes, sweetheart?
Who are you?
I'm Leslyn, one of the girls here at the Peach.
What do you mean by 'girls'?
Oh, I'm one of the whores here. I make my living on my back or on my knees. Or both. If that's your sort of thing, you can be the one on your knees or on your back. Price is 5 silver.
Ah, I've never played the womans part. Let's go upstairs and do that!
I'm sorry, I'll have to get going.
Upstairs you go then, I'll go get the broom handle!
Hmpfh!
Excuse me.
Word is there's outlaws in the area, I'll have to help the men repairing the gate.
Who are you?
I am {playername}. Who are you?
I am Lord Parr, representative of the great bank of Norvos, the Bank of the Stars.
I'm very busy {playername}! This septry have deep coffers, and I mean to milk them!
Who are you?
I am {playername}. Now, who are you?
I am Enneite, son of Enneite, son of Enneite, who was son of Enneite. I've taken a vow of obedience, and serve the Seven.
I'm very busy {playername}! The peacock escaped!
Hello there.
Hello. Who are you?
I'm Steffon, from Essos.
I'm very busy!
Co chceš?
Who are you?
I am Keth, son of Lar, son of Lar, son of Keth! I'm here to sell the goats we took!
Go away, or Keth, son of Lar, will chop off your head!
Co chceš?
Merely pass the time in a tavern. Do any interesting people ever come here?

I suppose Septon Germund is the man you'd talk to. Hear him tell it, he used to live a life of adventure down in the south. He's not here right now, but come back later, I'm sure you'll find him. Never far off when it comes to ale and wenches, even though he's a septon.
What?
Greetings. I am Germund, the septon of this part of town. I used to live in the castle, but alas, Lord Manderly does not take kindly to those who would filch saffron from his private stores...
Any news from the castle?
I have other things to do than to listen to a senile old man. Farewell.

Yes, {playername}. Maester Theomare had a raven a few days ago, from Eastwatch-by-the-Sea. We've been told to keep a watch out for wildlings, Cotter Pyke writes that they've grown ever bolder. One can only imagine, with the watch dwindled to next to nothing, and a new King-Beyond-the-Wall!
All very good, but how does that effect me?
Excuse me, I have important matters that require my attention.

We haven't seen any wildlings here for years, but we haven't had visitors from Hillhall in quite a while either, though they used to come here to sell their iron. They've had a special relationship with the port officials for aeons, had dispensation granted to them by one of the old Stark lords. Cregan, I think. It's been much too long since they came here last, now that I think of it. I need you to go and take a look at the village, see if anything is wrong.
I suppose I can go take a look.
I have better things to do than to visit some far away village. Farewell.

Oh, splendid! The village lies close to the Bay of Seals, north of Karhold. Should you find anything, travel bach here and speak with Gerold, he's a recruiter for the Night's Watch, and he can take your findings back to the Wall. Along with whatever lost souls he finds in the dungeons.
