If peace does not come soon, we can not hold on for much longer.
You are right. But who can stop this madness called war?
It is your duty to help the nobles in their war effort. You shouldn't complain about it.
Hah. The nobles fight their wars for their greed and their dreams of glory. And it is poor honest folk like us who have to bear the real burden. But you obviously don't want to hear about that.

There have been attempts to reconcile the two sides and reach a settlement. However, there are powerful lords on both sides whose interests lie in continuing the war. {reg0?They:These men} urge all others not to heed to the word of sensible men, but to keep fighting. While these leaders remain influential, no peace settlement can be reached.
Who are these warmongers who block the way of peace?
Who are these lords you speak of?
They are {s12} from {s15} and {s13} from {s14}. Until they change their mind or lose their influence, there will be no chance of having peace between the two sides.
What can be done about this?
Alas, it seems nothing can be done about it.

There is a way to resolve the issue. A particularly determined person can perhaps persuade one or both of these lords to accept making peace. And even if that fails, it can be possible to see that these lords are defeated by force and taken prisoner. If they are captive, they will lose their influence and they can no longer oppose a settlement... What do you think? Can you do it?
It seems difficult. But I will try.
If the price is right, I may.
Forget it. This is not my problem.

Most of the merchants in the town will gladly open up their purses to support such a plan. I think we can collect {reg12} coins between ourselves. We will be happy to reward you with that sum, if you can work this out. Convince {s12} and {s13} to accept a peace settlement, and if either of them proves too stubborn, make sure he falls captive and can not be ransomed until a peace deal is settled.
All right. I will do my best.
Sorry. I can not do this.
Excellent. You will have our blessings. I hope you can deal with those two old goats. We will be waiting and hoping for the good news.
Don't say no right away. Think about this for some time. If there is a {man/lady} who can manage to do this, it is you.

Do I indeed! There's a group of bandits infesting the town, and I'm at the end of my rope as to how to deal with them. They've been ambushing and robbing townspeople under the cover of night, and then fading away quick as lightning when the guards finally show up. We've not been able to catch a one of them. They only attack lone people, never daring to show themselves when there's a group about. I need someone who can take on these bandits alone and win. That seems to be the only way of bringing them to justice. Are you up to the task?

There's a group of bandits infesting the town, and I'm at the end of my rope as to how to deal with them. They've been ambushing and robbing townspeople under the cover of night, and then fading away quick as lightning when the guards finally show up. We've not been able to catch a one of them. They only attack lone people, never daring to show themselves when there's a group about. I need someone who can take on these bandits alone and win. That seems to be the only way of bringing them to justice. Are you up to the task?
Killing bandits? Why, certainly!
My apologies, I'm not interested.
That takes a weight off my shoulders, {playername}. You can expect a fine reward if you come back successful. Just don't get yourself killed, eh?
One of the merchants here is looking for herdsmen to take his cattle to the market at {s13}.

The cattle herd must be at {s13} within 30 days. Sooner is better, much better, but it must be absolutely no later than 30 days. If you can do that, I'd be willing to pay you {reg8} coins for your trouble. Interested?
Aye, I can take the herd to {s13}.
I am sorry, but no.
Splendid. You can find the herd right outside the town. After you take the animals to {s13}, return back to me and I will give you your pay.
I am afraid I can't offer you a job right now.
My good {Ser/my lady}. Our village is grateful for your help. Thanks to the {reg5} heads of cattle you have brought, we can now raise our own herd.
My good {lord/lady}, please, is there anything I can do for you?
Damn me, but you've done it, {playername}! You've wiped out all the smugglers. This village can prosper now. You certainly earned your reward. Here, take it, with my compliments.
{playername}. We have been waiting for word of a great battle between you and the smugglers, but we have heard nothing. Don't tell me you let them go?
Forgive me, elder, those smugglers were slippery as eels.
Hmph, that is hardly an excuse for failure, {playername}. Now if you will excuse me, I need to work on the village defences, for they will be back, sure as winter.

You disappoint me, {playername}. There were three groups of smugglers that I asked you to hunt down. Three! I suppose I should be grateful that they will not all return, their hearts black with vengeance for the poor villagers who sold them out. But some will return, and that will be a bloody business. Here. Take your reward, and let this business be done.

Thank you so much for finding the girl and sending her back. Hopefully this will be a lesson to all the foolish girls around here. We're struggling as it is, we can't afford any more of our young ones leaving and raising a brood in a rival village. How does that benefit anyone here? You have our thanks.

Well, I see there wasn't much point in sending you after the girl. Do you realise that this village is on the verge of extinction? Every year, we have fewer and fewer children, and see our youth leave us for the town, or for other villages. You have helped that process along. Bah!
Is there anything I can do for you?
Hello, {playername}. We are in your debt for bringing back the farmers wife.  You are truly a friend to our village.
Unfortunately I lost the woman on the way here...
Oh no! How am I going to tell this to the husband?
I'm sorry. I could do nothing about it.
You disappoint me, {playername}. I trusted you. I will let people know of your incompetence.
Welcome to {s9}, {s0}. We were rejoiced by the news that you are the new {lord/lady} of our humble village. I am the village elder and I will be honoured to serve you in any way I can.
Good day, {s0}, and welcome to {s9}. I am the elder of this village.
Your highness, you honour our humble village with your presence.
{My lord/My lady}, you honour our humble village with your presence.
Good day, {s0}.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
I am looking for a man by the name of {s4}. I was told he may be hiding here.
Strangers come and go to our village, {s0}. But I doubt you'll run into him at this hour of the night. You would have better luck during the day.
Strangers come and go to our village, {s0}. If he is hiding here, you will surely find him if you look around.
About the task you asked of me...
Do you have any tasks I can help you with?
I want to buy some supplies. I will pay with gold.
Of course, {Ser/my lady}. Do you want to buy goods or cattle?
I want to buy food and supplies.
We have some food and other supplies in our storehouse. Come have a look.
I want to buy some cattle.
{Změnil/Změnila} jsem názor. Nic nepotřebuji koupit.
Have you seen any enemies around here recently?
I am sorry, {s0}. We have neither seen nor heard of any war parties in this area.
Hmm. Let me think about it...
No, {s0}. We haven't seen any war parties in this area for some time.
Well, I guess that was all.
I need you to set a large fire on the outskirts of this village.
We have already agreed upon this, {s0}. I will do my best. You can trust me.
A fire, {s0}! Fires are dangerous! Why would you want such a thing?
I believe that we have already discussed this issue, {s0}.
We talked about this before {s0} and your previous offers were low compared to risk you want me to take.
I have my reasons, and you will have yours -- a purse of silver. Will you do it, or not?
Given the risk you are taking, you are entitled to know my plan.
I wish to rescue a prisoner from {s4}. When you light the fire, the guards in {s4} will see the smoke, and some of them will rush outside to see what is going on.
As you wish, {s0}. You have been a good friend to this village, and, even though there is a risk, we should be glad to return the favor. When do you want this fire to start?
I'm sorry, {s0}. You will forgive me for saying this, but we don't exactly have good reason to trust you. This is too dangerous.
As you say, {s0}. But in doing this, we are taking a very great risk. What's in it for us?
I can give you 100 coins.
I can give you 200 coins.
I can give you 300 coins.
Zapomeň na to.
This is madness. I cannot take such a risk.
Then let's increase your reward to 200 coins.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 coins.
Then let's increase your reward to 300 coins. This is my last offer.
Zapomeň na to.
Very well. You are asking me to take a very great risk, but I will do it. When do you want this fire to start?
I cannot do such a dangerous thing for 200 coins.
Continue with your preparations. One hour from now, I need that fire.
Do this in at the stroke of midnight. I will wait exactly one hour.
Very well, {my lord/my lady}. We will make our preparations. Now you make yours.
As you wish, {my lord/my lady}. May the heavens protect you.
[Leave]
We have {reg5} heads of cattle, each for {reg6} coins. How many do you want to buy?
I am afraid we have no cattle left in the village {Ser/my lady}.
One.
Two.
Three.
Four.
Five.
Forget it.
I will tell the herders to round up the animals and bring them to you, {Ser/my lady}. I am sure you will be satisfied with your purchase.
Yes , have you made any progress on it?
Indeed. I brought you {reg5} packs of grain.
My good {lord/lady}. You have saved us from hunger and desperation. We cannot thank you enough, but you'll always be in our prayers. The village of {s13} will not forget what you have done for us.
My good {lord/lady}, please, is there anything I can do for you?
Indeed. I brought you {reg5} bales of lumber.
My good {lord/lady}. You have returned in the nick of time. We will start construction right away. If it's alright with you, we shall name a barn after you!
My good {lord/lady}, please, is there anything I can do for you?
I am still working on it.
I am afraid I won't be able to finish it.
Thank you, {s0}. We are praying for your success everyday.
Ah, I am sorry to hear that {s0}. I'll try to think of something else.
Well {s0} you are already engaged with a task helping us. We cannot ask more from you.
No {s0}, We don't have any other tasks for you.
A task?

{My good sir/My good lady}, our village has been going through such hardships lately. The harvest has been bad, and recently some merciless bandits took away our seed grain that we had reserved for the planting season. If we cannot find some grain soon, we will not be able to plant our fields and then we will have nothing to eat for the coming year. If you can help us, we would be indebted to you forever.
Hmmm. How much grain do you need?
I can't be bothered with this. Ask help from someone else.
I think {reg5} packs of grain will let us start the planting. Hopefully, we can find charitable people to help us with the rest.
Then I will go and find you the grain you need.
I am afraid I don't have time for this. You'll need to find help elsewhere.
Thank you, {s0}. We'll be praying for you night and day.
Yes {s0}, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.

There is something you may be able to help us with, {playername}. To add to all our other troubles, recently the village has become home to a nest of smugglers, who are normally based out of {s3}. They drink and carouse, not to mention being engaged in the nefarious practice of smuggling. I am afraid a passing lord will happen upon them, and exact terrible retribution on our poor village. Can you help us with this problem?
I will deal with them. Where are they?
I fear I cannot accept such a mission at the moment.

Oh, that is good news, {playername}.  I'll send a boy to tell them that a raiding party has been seen on the horizon, and it appears to be making for {s4}. That should flush them out, and no doubt they will head directly for {s3}. It will then be up to you to hunt them down. Good luck.
It looks like we must labour under this curse for a while longer then. Good day, {playername}.

My {lord/lady}! You must help! They're eating all our food! Wait, arh, let me explain. Several days ago, a party of noblemen arrived in the village. They were on their way to {s8}, when they were attacked by bandits. Their escort fled, and the noblemen themselves barely made it here.

And now we can't get rid of them! They refuse to leave without an escort and they're chubby fellows, my {lord/lady}. They eat, and eat, and eat. If we don't get rid of them soon, we'll all be in grave danger come winter. If you can take them to {s8}, we will be eternally grateful. But please, don't lose them along the way, for sure as a pig is a pig, they'll be back here like a shot.
I will escort the nobles.
Sorry. I can't do that right now
Thank you, my friend. We'll wish you the speed of a fox.
Yes, yes, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.
We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Our thanks.

Well, we have almost reached {s21}. We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Here's your pay... {reg14} coins. Thanks for escorting us. Oh, and we realise you have had to put up with a lot on this journey, which was one such as should be commemorated in verse! Please accept this book - careful, careful, it belonged to a famous maester, as an extra reward. Now, I believe the inn is open. Farewell and may the Father Above bless you!.

Well, we have almost reached {s21}. We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Here's your pay... {reg14} coins. We also had a present for you, a token of our esteem, but you seem unable to carry any more. Never mind that then! Thanks for escorting us. Good luck and may the Warrior give your arm strength!
Greetings. You must be our escort, right?
Yes. My name is {playername}. I will lead you to {s1}.
Well, It is good to know we won't travel alone. What do you want us to do now?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. We'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. We'll be waiting here for you.

Young {man/lady}! I really do think we should, ah, get a move on. We really can't tarry in this area. We must reach a sept soon, or we shall, erm, expire. Although I don't expect one such as yourself to understand... eh?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. We'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. We'll be waiting here for you.
Give me your valuables!
This is an outrage! Don't think you can threaten us, you heathen oaf. Now hurry on and make sure the way is safe.
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. We'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. We'll be waiting here for you.
I've had it with your incessant whining. Let's see if the pen is mightier than the sword!
To arms, brothers!

Actually, I was looking for a reliable {man/helper} that can undertake an important mission. The wife of one of our farmers was taken by bandits a couple of days ago. The man is distraught. We canot pay you, my {lord/lady}, but you would always be welcome in our village if you could bring her back.

The amount the bandits ask as ransom is {reg12} coins.  You have 15 days to take the money to the bandits who will be waiting near the village of {s4}. Those bastards said that they are going to rape the woman if they don't get the money by that time.
Alright. I will take the ransom money to the bandits and bring back the wife.
Good. I knew we could trust you at this. And please, don't attempt to do anything rash. Keep in mind that the womans virtue is more important than anything else...
Sorry. I don't have time for this right now.
Yes, yes, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.
Thank you so much for bringing me back!  I can't wait to see my family, my sisters and mother, even my husband!
Yes. Come with me. We are going home.
Unfortunately, you do not have room in your party for me.
Oh really? Thank you so much!
Wait here a while longer. I'll come back for you.
Oh, please {my lord/my lady}, do not leave me here all alone!
Oh {my lord/my lady}. Thank you so much for rescuing me. Will you take me to my family now?
Yes. Come with me. We are going home.
Unfortunately, you do not have room in your party for me.
Oh really? Thank you so much!
Wait here a while longer. I'll come back for you.
Oh, please {my lord/my lady}, do not leave me here all alone!
Can I come with you now?

I have a delicate matter and I'm in need of help, there's a young maiden called {s4} who has run off with a lad from a neighbouring village. Run off! Can you believe it? We're living in changing times. When I were a boy, something like this would be unthinkable. Anyway, her father is on my back, night and day, saying that as Elder, I should get her back. That puts me in an uncomfortable position, so I'm thinking you might head over to {s3} and convince the girl to come back. What do you say?
I will go there and find the girl.
I am too busy to go after her at the moment.

That's excellent, {playername}. I will be grateful to you and so will the family of the girl. Tsk, the youth of today. Well, good luck finding her. Oh, one more thing - you'd better make haste. In my experience, these things are usually settled within a couple of days.
As you wish, {playername}. I suppose I'll have to go there myself, and deal with their elder... He's a miserable old so-and-so.

{My good lord/My good lady}, our village has been going through such hardships lately. We recently suffered a bandit attack - alas, it is all too common these days. The wretches, not content with ransacking the village, also burned down several buildings. As it stands, we have nowhere to store the harvest. We could use some lumber to help rebuild our village. If you can help us, we would be indebted to you forever.
Hmmm. How much lumber do you need?
I can't be bothered with this. Gather your own wood, peasant.
I think {reg5} bales of lumber will let us start building. We have plenty of keen villagers to help us with that.
Then I will go and find you the lumber you need.
I am afraid I don't have time for this. You'll need to find help elsewhere.
Thank you, {my lord/my lady}. We'll be praying for you night and day!
Yes, yes, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.

We are suffering greatly at the hands of a group of bandits. They take our food and livestock, and kill anyone who doesn't obey them immediately. Our men are angry that we cannot defend ourselves, but we are only simple farmers... However, with some help, I think that some of the people here could be more than that. We just need an experienced warrior to teach us how to fight.
I can teach you how to defend yourself.
You peasants have no business taking up arms. Just pay the bandits and be off with it.

You will? Oh, splendid! We would be deeply indebted to you, {s0}. I'll instruct the village folk to assemble here and receive your training. If you can teach us how to defend ourselves, I promise you'll receive everything we can give you in return for your efforts.
Yes, of course {s0}.  Thank you for your counsel.
Bandits have driven away our cattle. Our pastures are empty. If we had just a few heads of cattle we could start to raise a herd again.
How many animals do you need?
I don't have time for this. Ask help from someone else.
I think {reg5} heads will suffice for a small herd.
Then I will bring you the cattle you need.
I am afraid I don't have time for this. You'll need to find help elsewhere.
Thank you, {s0}. We'll be praying for you night and day.
Yes {s0}, of course. I am sorry if I have bothered you with our troubles.
Thank you, {s0}, but we do not really need anything right now.
{My lord/my lady}, you honour my humble shop with your presence.
Welcome {s0}. What can I do for you?
Ještě něco?
I want to buy a few items... and perhaps sell some.
Sure, sure... Here, have a look at my stock...
Ještě něco?
What goods should I buy here to trade with other towns?
Nothing. Thanks.

That information can be best obtained from caravan masters and travelling merchants. If you want I can send you to the district where foreign merchants stay at when they come to the town. If you spend some time there and listen to the talk, you can learn a lot about what to buy and where to sell it.
Then I'll go and spend some time with these merchants.
I have no time for this right now.
Good day friend. If you came to watch the tourneys you came in vain. There won't be a tourney here anytime soon.
Tourney? So they hold the tourneys here...

Yes. You should see this place during one of the melee fights. Everyone from the town and nearby villages comes here. The crowd becomes mad with excitement. Anyway, as I said, there won't be an event here soon, so there isn't much to see. Except, there is an official duel every now and then, and  of course we have melee fights almost every day.
Tell me about the melee fights.

The fighters and knights get bored waiting for the next melee, so they have invented the training melee. It is a simple idea really. Fighters jump into the arena with a weapon. There are no rules, no teams. Everyone beats at each other until there is only one fighter left standing. Sounds like fun, eh?
Is there a reward?

There is, actually. Some of the wealthy townsmen offer prizes for those fighters who show great skill in the fights. If you can beat {reg1} opponents before going down, you'll earn {reg11} coins. You'll get {reg12} coins for striking down at least {reg2} opponents, {reg13} coins if you can defeat {reg3} opponents, and {reg14} coins if you can survive long enough to beat {reg4} opponents. If you can manage to be the last {man/fighter} standing, you'll earn the great prize of the fights, {reg15} coins. Sounds good, eh?

Some of the wealthy townsmen offer prizes for those fighters who show great skill in the fights. If you can beat {reg1} opponents before going down, you'll earn {reg11} coins. You'll get {reg12} coins for striking down at least {reg2} opponents, {reg13} coins if you can defeat {reg3} opponents, and {reg14} coins if you can survive long enough to beat {reg4} opponents. If you can manage to be the last {man/fighter} standing, you'll earn the great prize of the fights, {reg15} coins. Sounds good, eh?
Can I join too?
Ha ha. You would have to be out of your mind not to. Of course. The melee fights are open to all. Actually there is going to be a fight soon. You can go and hop in if you want to.
Hello. You seem to be new here. Care to share your name?
I am {playername}.
Well met {playername}. I am the herald of the tourneys here at {s1}. Talk to me if you want to join the fights.

Ha-ha, that's quite the bruise you're sporting. But don't worry; everybody gets trounced once in awhile. The important thing is to pick yourself up, dust yourself off and keep fighting. That's what champions do.
Hey, you managed to take down {reg8} opponents. Not bad. But that won't bring you any prize money. Now, if I were you, I would go back there and show everyone what I can do...
You put up quite a good fight there. Good moves. You definitely show promise. And you earned a prize of {reg10} coins for knocking down {reg8} opponents.
That was a good fight you put up there. You managed to take down no less than {reg8} opponents. And of course, you earned a prize money of {reg10} coins.

Your performance was amazing! You are without doubt a very skilled fighter. Not everyone can knock down {reg8} people in the fights. Of course you deserve a prize with that performance: {reg10} coins. Nice, eh?
That was damned good fighting, {playername}. You have very good moves, excellent tactics. And you earned a prize of {reg10} coins for knocking down {reg8} opponents.

Congratulations champion! Your fight there was something to remember! You managed to be the last fighter standing beating down everyone else. And of course you won the grand prize of the fights: {reg10} coins.
Hello {playername}. Good to see you again.
What would you like to do?
About the melee fights...
I would like to spar with some of my men.
Will there be a tourney in nearby towns soon?
I need to leave now. Good bye.
Certainly. The arena is currently available. Of course, you will have to supply your own gear, which means there will be no team uniforms.  But that aside, how many teams would you like?
Two.
Three.
Four.
Zapomeň na to. {Změnil/Změnila} jsem názor.
Team One is full. Team Two is next.
There {reg1?are:is} currently {reg0} {reg1?troops:troop} on Team One.  Which troop would you like to add?
{s11}. ({reg0} left.)
{s11} has been added to Team One.
I am finished with Team One.  Let's move on to Team Two.
Zapomeň na to. Celé to odvolám.
Team Two is full. Team Three is next.
Team Two is full. Let the match begin!
There {reg1?are:is} currently {reg0} {reg1?troops:troop} on Team Two.  Which troop would you like to add?
{s11}. ({reg0} left.)
{s11} has been added to Team Two.
I am finished with Team Two.  Let's move on to Team Three.
I am finished with Team Two.  Let's begin the match.
Zapomeň na to. Celé to odvolám.
Team Three is full. Team Four is next.
Team Three is full. Let the match begin!
There {reg1?are:is} currently {reg0} {reg1?troops:troop} on Team Three.  Which troop would you like to add?
{s11}. ({reg0} left.)
{s11} has been added to Team Three.
I am finished with Team Three.  Let's move on to Team Four.
I am finished with Team Three.  Let's begin the match.
Never mind. I'm calling the whole thing off.
Team Four is full. Let the match begin!
There {reg1?are:is} currently {reg0} {reg1?troops:troop} on Team Four.  Which troop would you like to add?
{s11}. ({reg0} left.)
{s11} has been added to Team Four.
I am finished with Team Four.  Let's begin the match.
Zapomeň na to. Celé to odvolám.
Here you go then. Good luck.
{reg2?There won't be any tournaments any time soon.:{reg1?Tournaments are:A tournament is} going to be held at {s15}.}
There will be a fight here soon. You can go and jump in if you like.
Good. That's what I am going to do.
Well, please choose a weapon which you like.
I'll use my own weapons!
Thanks. But I will give my bruises some time to heal.
Good {man/girl}. That's clever of you.
Actually, can you tell me about the rewards again?
Hello {boy/girl}. If you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Then you'd better bring your purse. I have got prisoners to sell.
Not this time. Good-bye.
Let me see what you have...
You take more prisoners, bring them to me. I will pay well.
I'll give you nothing but cold steel, you scum!
There's no need to fight. I can pay for free passage.
Silver without blood, that's our favourite kind! Hmm, having a look at you, I reckon you could easily come up with {reg5} coins. Pay it, and we'll let you be on your way.
Very well, take it.
I don't have that much money with me
That's too bad. I guess we'll just have to sell you into slavery. Take {him/her}, lads!
Hey, I've heard of you! You slaughter us freebooters like dogs, and now you expect us to let you go for a few stinking coins? Forget it. You gave us no quarter, and you'll get none from us.
Heh, that wasn't so hard, was it? All right, we'll let you go now. Be off.
Eh? What is it?
Your luck has run out, wretch. Prepare to die!
Never mind, I have no business with you.
Do you want us to follow you?
Yes. Let us ride together.
No. Not at this time.
It does not appear that you have room for us, {m'lord/m'lady}.
We are at your command.
You will not capture me again. Not this time.
You don't have a chance against me. Give up.
I will give up when you are dead!
I beg you, please leave us alone.
Do you think you can run away from me? You will be my prisoner or die!
Ok. We'll leave you in peace for this time, do not face with us again.
Haven't you got any mercy? Ok, we will fight you to the last man!
Hmmm. 10 coins for each looter makes {reg1} coins for all {reg0} of them.
Let me see. You've brought {reg0} bandits, so 20 coins for each comes up to {reg1} coins.
Well well, you've captured {reg0} brigands. Each one is worth 30 coins, so I'll give you {reg1} for them in total.
I suppose that'll be all, then.
NO TEXT
You carry the valyrian sword Heartsbane.
What of it?
I desire the sword.
Never mind.
I am your prisoner, do as you will. But know this, you cur. I will take it back. And I will see you strung up.
You carry the valyrian sword Lady Forlorn.
You carry the valyrian sword Nightfall.
Lord Renly, the king has decreed that your titles, holdings and your life is forfeit.
Do you have any last words?

Why should Stannis be king, and not me? The crown would suit me like it never suited Robert, and it would certainly never suit Stannis! If you would serve me, you would be well rewarded. Gold, lands, honors, I'll grant you everything in my power!
I am a {man/woman} of honor. I shall spare your life this day!
Ah, the gods be good! Thank you, {playername}.
You do not deserve leiniency. You must pay for your crimes with your life.
In the name of Stannis, of the House Baratheon, the First of His Name, King of Westeros, I do sentence you to die.  Have you any final words to say?
No! Do not do it! I'll bend the knee, I swear!
(The prisoner struggles against his shackles, desperate to free himself and escape you, but to no avail. You slit his throat and watch, satisfied, as his corpse sags to the floor.)
Yes, {s1}?
You are free to go.
You will remain my prisoner.
Despite what you may have heard, I am a {man/woman} of honor.  You are free to go.
I will not forget this act of chivalry!
You will understand if I keep you hostage until your family can afford to compensate me for certain expenses and hardships I must endure to keep you fed and... safe.
Truly, this is beneath you! I thought you where a {man/woman} of honor!
And I trust you will be as understanding when I hunt you down like the cur you are!
You there!
Who, me?!
You don't look as useless as the rest of the prisoners.

Listen, you have one last chance to redeem yourself. Drop all your previous allegiances and swear fealty to me, obey my every order to the letter, and you'll be paid, fed and equipped. If you don't... well, let's just say that accidents happen all the time, and no one will miss a prisoner of war.
Thank you for your mercy, my {lord/lady}!. I swear on my mothers grave, I will serve you!
If only I had a sword, I'd show you what I think of your offer! Now get lost, I'm not interested.
I see...
If you fail to obey a single one of my commands, I will have you severely disciplined!
In my camp, all the men are treated as equals, but I expect your obedience.
I will obey your wishes, my {lord/lady}.  I swear!
Oh! Apparently there isn't enough room for you in my party. I will be back when I have made space.
Excellent. Now go make ready. There is hard fighting ahead.
As wretched as you are, I cannot help but feel sorry for you.
I'm feeling magnanimous today.  Begone, before I change my mind!
Oh, thank you, my {lord/lady}.  A thousand blessings on you!
I have no room for useless mouths in my retinue. You'll have to die.
Any last words?
Please, my {lord/lady}, don't kill me. I am a defenceless prisoner. Surely, you're not that cruel?
Yes, I am.
No, I will not sink that low.

(The prisoner struggles against his shackles, desperate to free himself and escape you, but to no avail. You slit their throat with a knife and watch, satisfied, as the corpse sags to the floor, blood spraying across your face.)
Get back in line!
All right, I have made room for you.
I am at your command, my {lord/lady}.
I am sorry, I still have no room for you. You'll have to wait a while longer.
Greetings, {s0}. How can I serve you today?
Good day. What can I do for you?
I want to buy a new weapon. Show me your wares.
I am looking for some equipment. Show me what you have.
I am thinking of buying a horse.
Ah, yes {s0}. These arms are the best you'll find anywhere.
Of course, {s0}. You won't find better quality armour than these in all the known world.
You have a fine eye for horses, {s0}. You won't find better beasts than these anywhere else.
Ještě něco?
Tell me. What are people talking about these days?
Well, nothing new lately. Prices, weather, the war, the same old things.
Good-bye.
My {lord/lady}?
Good day, {s0}.
I am looking for a man by the name of {s4}. I was told he may be hiding here.
Strangers come and go to our village, {s0}. If he is hiding here, you will surely find him if you look around.
Pardon me, but is that a {s5} you're wearing?
Eh? What kind of gibberish is that?
Zapomeň na to.
{s4} sent me to collect your reports. Do you have them with you?
I've been expecting you. Here they are, make sure they reach {s4} intact and without delay.
Farewell.
What can you tell me about this village?
What can you tell me about this town?
How is life here?

Disaster has struck my family, {s0}. We have no land of our own, and the others have no money to pay for our labor, or even to help us. My poor children lie at home hungry and sick. I don't know what we'll do.
My life is miserable, {s0}. I haven't been able to find a job for months, and my poor children go to bed hungry each night. My neighbours are too poor themselves to help me.
Then take these 300 coins. I hope this will help you and your family.
Then clearly you must travel somewhere else, or learn another trade.
Yes. I will do as you say.
{My lord/My good lady}.  You are so good and generous. I will tell everyone how you helped us.
Thank you for your kindness {s0}. With your help our lives will be better. I will pray for you everyday.
Times are hard, {s0}. We work hard all day and yet we go to sleep hungry most nights.
Times are hard, {s0}. But we must count our blessings.
We are not doing too badly {s0}. We must count our blessings.

So -- hopefully we'll meet again!

You seem a little disoriented. I do not know who you are or where you're from, and, to tell you the truth, I do not care. I'm just a simple merchant, and if I've learned anything, it's that the merchants are the first to suffer in hard times. So, I am planning to travel to another country, peaceful and rainless, I hope. I have heard that in the Free Cities gold flows from watery fountains, so maybe I'll go try my fortune in Pentos or Volantis.

Anyways, I advise you, before I leave, to do the same and seek your own fortune in other lands. War is sure to engulf the Seven Kingdoms, now that the Hand has been executed, and the people will be nothing more than war fodder. Poverty feeds on the weak, and the strong men abuse the sword and the lance to impose their power and control over the humble ones. In order to trade we must pay heavy taxes in each city, sort out bandits and pirates, and pray that a local lord, ignorant and lazy, do not decide to get half of our merchandise to fund his next feast or buy a new horse for his son.

But I am getting ahead of myself. Take my advice and go across the Narrow Sea. Until a new king has been crowned and anointed by the High Septon, law and unity will remain a vulture's feasting table. So I say, seek your destiny elsewhere.
I think I'll stay. War brings opportunity, and I mean to seize my chance! Make a name for myself!
Go to Essos, what do I care?

Oh? Well, I suppose you're right at that - but remember this. War also brings maimed men and raped women, dead children and shattered hopes. Still, you have a certain look of ability to you... Take this silver, and remember me, should you ever make something of yourself.
